summary: Paul Merson restarted his row with Andros Townsend after the Tottenham midfielder was brought on with only seven minutes remaining in his team's 0-0 draw with Burnley on Sunday. Merson initially angered Townsend for writing in his Sky Sports column that 'if Andros Townsend can get in (the England team) then it opens it up to anybody.' Townsend hit back at Merson on Twitter after scoring for England against Italy. Merson admitted his mistake after Townsend hit a stunning equaliser for England against Italy.

Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto. If Muto completes a move to Stamford Bridge this summer, he will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. Muto graduated from Keio University with an economics degree. He has 11 international caps for Japan, scoring 1 goal. Muto admits it is an honour to receive the offer from Chelsea although he has not yet decided to join the club.

A study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers. The researchers said that antibiotics may be fattening our children and contributing to the obesity epidemic. The Finnish researchers compared the weight and height of more than 12,000 healthy two year old with records on antibiotic prescription and found that children who had taken antibiotics as young babies were particularly likely to be overweight. Lead author Dr Antti Saari warned that antibiotic exposure before six months of age, or repeatedly during infancy, was associated with increased body mass in healthy children.

A Queen's Guard slipped and fell on a manhole cover in front of tourists during the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace. The guard lost his footing, dropping his rifle. A tourist, David Meadwell, recorded the incident. The guard was embarrassed, but quickly got to his feet. The incident is thought to have occurred because of the metal protectors nailed to the soles of his boots.

In 2016 A&E, Lifetime and History will simulcast a remake of "Roots," the 1977 miniseries about Kunta Kinte, an African who was captured and sold into slavery. LeVar Burton, who portrayed Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new miniseries. The new version will draw more from Alex Haley's novel and producers will consult scholars for authenticity. Mark Wolper, son of the original's producer, is also an executive producer.

Christopher Lawler, a former royal footman, reported that palace aides tried to force him into an orgy at Clarence House in January 1978 when he was 27. He was pinned to a chair and groped by a male member of staff on his first day. He said he was accosted after he walked into a bedroom to look for a pen on his first shift. After hearing about the probe into historical cases of child abuse last year he wrote to the Palace, but was twice rebuffed. Months later the complaint was finally passed to Scotland Yard. A retired royal aide, who is now in his 80s, was reportedly interviewed but denied he was involved because he was working for the Queen in Balmoral at the time. The Royal Household would work ‘exhaustively and co-operatively’ with any police probe.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced they are expecting a child in a rap video set to the theme song from the '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' The video, which features the couple rapping in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. At the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child. The video was made so loved ones living far away could know about the baby. It took five takes to film the clip. After finding out the gender of the child, another video is a possibility for the Meeks.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh in Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction. The gray jacket and skirt with a black zigzag applique was worn in several scenes. The dress was originally slate blue-gray but has faded to light gray. The dress was part of a collection of more than 150 items from James Tumblin, who collected over 300,000 pieces of memorabilia, and he bought the dress for $20. Other items that were sold were a straw hat worn by Leigh for $52,500, a suit worn by Clark Gable for $55,000, and a bonnet worn by Leigh and Olivia De Havilland for $30,000.

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The child was rescued by his parents and suffered minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents while in the pit. Cleveland Metroparks Zoo has plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera, which has not been working for two years, was angled directly at the front door of a house in Handsworth, Birmingham. The camera was one of around 300 speed and traffic cameras turned off across the region in March 2013 due to old technology. Birmingham City Council is aware of the issue and will send an engineer to the site, and the camera could be removed completely. There are no plans to include the camera in Wellington Road in a new pilot program using digital technology.

Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. He said he is fit, healthy and ready to run. The JAAA General Secretary commented that he was pleased that Usain was available for selection and that the world's fastest man will be running for Jamaica. The full Jamaican team list for the competition will be announced shortly.

Neymar and Dani Alves watched Barcelona's basketball side win 85-80 in their Euro League contest against Real Madrid, although Real Madrid remain top of their Euro League division due to points difference. Neymar helped Brazil beat Chile 1-0 at the Emirates Stadium. Before the international break Barcelona won their El Clasico contest. Barcelona play Celta Vigo on Sunday.

Italy is dealing with an increase of migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe. From Friday to Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued. There are fears that 400 migrants could be missing after a ship carrying 550 people capsized in the Mediterranean Sea about 80 miles off the Libyan coast. Italy registered more than 10,000 migrants arriving in the first three months of 2015, and about 2,000 were rescued at sea during the first weekend of April in the Channel of Sicily. Most migrants recorded this year come from countries in West Africa as well as Somalia and Syria. At least 480 migrants have died while crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year.

Arsene Wenger does not know why Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over Liverpool. Wenger was aware of Liverpool's interest in Sanchez and thought it could be because of Barcelona's interest in Suarez. Wenger believes Sanchez is one of the best around. Wenger has played down speculation linking him with Raheem Sterling.

On June 7, Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record at London's Olympic Velodrome. The current record is 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February. Tickets go on sale from April 19, and the event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports.

Serena Williams beat Sara Errani in the Fed Cup play-off on Sunday, but said the struggle was a real 'eye-opener' as the claycourt season gets into full swing. The US were beaten 3-2, meaning they were relegated to World Group II. Williams said she is not as ready for the claycourt season as she thought she was. Her doubles defeat left the US facing a battle to get back amongst the elite nations next year.

River Plate are interested in signing Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao, who played for the Argentine side for eight years before leaving for Porto in 2009. River Plate vice president Matias Patanian said that they 'dream of Falcao Garcia' and that 'the doors are open'. Falcao has struggled during his loan spell at Manchester United, but has been in good goalscoring form for Colombia recently. He scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for River Plate.

In 2015, X Factor finalist Ella Henderson, age 19, became the official face of Batiste's 'Ready For It' campaign, marking her first brand collaboration. The campaign, put together by the MILES agency, includes images of the singer with various hairstyles against a vibrant city background and launched with a TV ad featuring her single, Mirror Man. Mark Hargreaves, CEO of Crown Talent & Media Group, notes the collaboration is Henderson's first endorsement.

After officer Pablo Torres fatally shot Aaron Siler, the Kenosha Professional Police Association put up a billboard thanking the community for its support and featuring a photo of Torres and his dog. Siler's family and friends are in shock and have called the billboard disrespectful, asking for it to be taken down. The police association claims that no offense was intended. The shooting occurred after a vehicle and foot pursuit, and Siler was wanted on an active felony probation and parole warrant. Ten days prior, Torres shot and wounded Terry Knight, who was armed with two knives. The investigation into Siler's death continues.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. Three of the militants were killed by Iranian forces. The militant group Jaish al Adal claimed responsibility for the attack. The Pakistani government condemned the attack, calling it an "act of terrorism."

Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told the Diet that the country's Air Self Defense Force has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. This was in response to a query from former wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki, who also claims to have seen a UFO.

A 35-year-old passenger, Jin Pai, was hospitalised with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after he broke a toilet he was squatting on in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport in the city of Hefei. He was standing on the rim of the toilet because he was worried it might not be clean. The porcelain toilet then tipped over and shattered on the floor, cutting the man. He was found bleeding on the toilet floor and taken to a Hefei hospital. He received several dozens stitches on his left leg and buttocks. He reportedly confessed to his friends that he was squatting on the toilet, but later changed his story to the police. Authorities said they believed the incident was an accident.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested after a 15-year-old girl found a hidden camera in her bathroom that police were able to trace back to him. He faces charges including aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children and invasion of privacy. The investigation began when the girl found a hidden camera in March. Investigators found 41 videos from the hidden camera that included footage of the girl and others while they used the bathroom. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including other juveniles, but had purchased the camera specifically so he could record the now-15-year-old victim while she undressed and showered. Rebbie's preliminary hearing is on May 1 and he is being held on a $500,000 bail.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's series of images capture teenagers next to their fathers leaping into the air. The images are from the 37-year-old's latest book which roughly translates into Daughter and Salary Man. Each image sees the daughter stood po-faced as their father makes an energetic leap. The pictures see the families pose in front of various Japanese landmarks. Very little is known about the set of photos but they are already drumming up plenty of interest online.

Paul Downton's dismissal as England's managing director has occurred, but focus has shifted to the start of the county championship season. Kevin Pietersen is hoping to return to the England set-up, after being controversially axed in 2014. Pietersen posed for the Surrey team photo before the start of the new campaign at the KIA Oval, with Surrey set to begin their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19. Surrey play Oxford MCCU in a MCC University match on Sunday.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, a Romanian club threatened with relegation, has fired Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. He was initially fired on Wednesday, reinstated on Thursday, and then fired again after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani on Saturday. Ze Maria, who replaced Florin Marin in January, will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Nabil Dirar believes Radamel Falcao must be regretting his failed loan move to Manchester United, even though he was not happy in France. Manchester United are unlikely to make Falcao's transfer permanent. Dirar revealed that Falcao was not happy in France but thinks he would have been better off staying at Monaco.

Police are asking the public for help identifying a 'very tall' man who robbed a Christchurch dairy on Saturday wearing a 'distinctive' cartoon mask and a fluoro orange sweatshirt. He took the till and about $1500 in cash. There were no weapons used. Anyone with information should call Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 or message police online.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old Texas math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, was arrested on Monday after being accused of having sex with a 15-year-old pupil in her car on consecutive nights in January. She was previously arrested on March 19 for having an inappropriate relationship with another 15-year-old student, admitting to kissing him and allowing him to touch her breasts in April of the previous year. Granado was suspended from teaching and put on administrative leave by school officials. She was booked into Irving County Jail for the second time on Monday and released after posting a $50,000 bail.

A video of a crocodile swimming through a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its jaws has been viewed more than 500,000 times. New Zealander Tim Weston, who was on holiday, witnessed the event. The dog belonged to the local bike shop's owner and was caught by the crocodile near the water's edge. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta, living in a nearby sanctuary and are regularly spotted on the resort's golf course.

Steve Bruce is confident he can keep Hull City in the Barclays Premier League this season and avoid relegation, despite a 2-0 defeat by Southampton. At the start of the campaign Bruce was targeting 10 wins to survive, but his Hull side have mustered just six and he is hoping 'nine or eight might be enough.' Hull now have six games to save their season including fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham and Manchester United. Ronald Koeman's Southampton moved to fifth in the table.

Ian Guffick was banned from the classroom after he let pupils change their exam answers, invalidating his whole school's SATs results. Guffick asked pupils to make changes to the national curriculum tests for 11-year-olds, despite the exam session finishing. The 31-year-old also altered a number of the pupil's exam answers himself before the papers were sent off. The Department for Education annulled all SATs exam results for the entire school last year. Guffick admitted the allegations and accepted it amounted to unacceptable professional conduct. Paul Heathcote banned Guffick from the classroom for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard, a Manchester United goalkeeper who has struggled for minutes, married Swedish model Misse Beqiri last year in Mauritius. They have been dating since 2012 and have a son together. Beqiri has Albanian roots and posts modelling photos on her Instagram page. Lindegaard moved to the Premier League in 2010 but has failed to make an impact and is now third-choice at Old Trafford.

Glowing blue letters that once lit the Bronx from above Yankee Stadium failed to find a buyer at a Sotheby's auction on Wednesday. The 13 letters were expected to bring in anywhere from $300,000 to $600,000. The current owner of the signage is Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased the 10-feet-tall letters for an undisclosed amount after the stadium saw its final game in 2008. The letters had beamed from atop Yankee Stadium near Grand Concourse in the Bronx since 1976. Sotheby's was also auctioning off a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 60s, which raked in a winning bid of $112,500 at auction.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has reminded Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities after Sterling was exposed for inhaling nitrous oxide and both were pictured with shisha pipes. Rodgers spoke to them but neither will be disciplined. Rodgers also said Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final with Aston Villa.

Mesut Ozil posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog on Wednesday after returning home to London. Ozil impressed on international duty as Germany beat Gerogia 2-0 in a Euro 2016 qualifier on Sunday. Ozil missed Arsenal's last game against Newcastle through illness, but will be expected to start against Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium. Since January, he has four assists and three goals.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu says that there are no plans to replace Luis Enrique, and they are very happy with him. Enrique took charge of the club last summer, signing a two-year deal. Bartomeu says he's impressed with how the manager has performed. Enrique has a contract until 2016.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool worth around £100,000-a-week, that will run until the summer of 2020. Henderson is the third big player to agree to a contract extension, and could replace Steven Gerrard as Liverpool captain. Talks with Raheem Sterling are not expected to resume until the end of the season.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea until the end of his contract, despite Atletico Madrid considering bringing him back in the summer. Luis signed a three-year contract last July. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is refusing to let his league leaders rest on their laurels until the job is done. Luis played for Brazil against France and Chile.

Nathan Hughes's ban for accidentally knocking out George North was overturned on appeal. Hughes was initially suspended for three matches after his knee collided with North's head as North scored a try for Northampton on March 27. The dismissal has been rescinded and the ban was thrown out after an appeal. North was left unconscious and has been advised to take a month off from playing. Hughes missed his side's Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon. The appeal panel concluded that no foul play took place and that the incident occurred accidentally.

The fiery sunsets seen in Washington were the result of raging wildfires in parts of Siberia, which were started by farmers burning grass in their fields. The flames quickly grew out of control because of strong winds and spread throughout the region. The lingering smoke from the widespread fires were picked up by atmospheric winds and carried across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest. The reason people are seeing an intense red sunset is a result of smoke particles filtering out the shorter wavelength colors from the sunlight like greens, blues, yellows and purples.

Becky Schoenig had her brand new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway on Monday night. Police found her car after receiving a tip and returned it to her with new red rims and detailing. Schoenig took to Facebook to thank the car thieves for pimping out her vehicle. She is getting the vehicle professionally cleaned to deal with the smell of cigarettes and marijuana and is creating a smoothie at her restaurant to honor the man who located her car.

Manchester City players will lose £500,000 each in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. Players such as Sergio Aguero, David Silva, Joe Hart and Yaya Toure have incentivised contracts to make sure the club stay within financial fairplay requirements. The City squad have around £12million resting on reaching their European target. The top three finishers in the Premier League qualify automatically for the Champions League with the fourth-place team required to win a qualifying round to join them.

The Under 18s Manchester United team won against Manchester City 1-0 in the 'mini-derby'. Callum Gribbin scored the winning goal with a free-kick. 13 of the 22 players were English, 10 of whom were Mancunian. The match was played at Altrincham's home ground and was attended by close to 1,000 people.

Joe Hart called Gianluigi Buffon a 'legend of the game' after Buffon claimed his 147th cap. Hart, who earned his 50th cap, said Buffon was an inspiration. Hart wants to keep playing well for his club and country and add to his 50 international caps.

Chipotle is teaming up with Postmates to enter the $70 billion food delivery market, offering delivery in 67 cities with a nine percent service charge and delivery fees starting at $5. Chipotle had previously turned down offers for collaboration but has now partnered with Postmates. Other franchises such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's and Burger King are also hoping to cash in on the delivery market. Presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton have been spotted in Chipotle restaurants.

Bill and Denise Richard, the parents of the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombing, are asking that the death penalty be removed as a possible punishment for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was found guilty on all 30 charges he faced. The Richards are urging the Justice Department to bring the case to a close in exchange for the defendant spending the rest of his life in prison without any possibility of release and waiving all of his rights to appeal. They state that the continued pursuit of the death penalty could bring years of appeals and prolong reliving the most painful day of their lives.

A mystery billionaire had a Boeing 747 custom-built over three years for £400 million. The jumbo jet, which would normally carry 600 passengers, was built for a single tycoon, though it can fit dozens of guests. It contains a large dining room with an adjoining kitchen, a lounge, a 'state room', and an 'aeroloft' on the top deck with eight full beds.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying an uncrewed Dragon cargo spacecraft to the International Space Station from Cape Canaveral, Florida. The attempt to land the rocket stage on a floating barge was unsuccessful; the rocket landed on the droneship but tipped over. The Dragon will dock with the space station a couple of days after launch to deliver more than 4,300 pounds of supplies, including research equipment and ISSpresso. The space station crew will spend about five weeks unpacking the Dragon, then stuff it with over 3,000 pounds of science experiments, trash, and other stuff to send back to Earth. Dragon will then splashdown in the Pacific Ocean off California. This is the sixth SpaceX mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding to be held at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas. She collaborated with NBC's Today show to launch a contest for one Elvis-obsessed couple to win the 'ultimate wedding'. The winning couple will be announced next Monday and will tie the knot on Thursday, April 23. The winning couple will win a free wedding reception, a hotel suite for two nights, airfares, and concert tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. Priscilla made it clear that there would be no impersonators. Couples wanting to be the first to wed at the chapel must submit a video or photos along with an explanation detailing why they deserve the prize.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson thinks his side could catch Manchester City in the Premier League. Henderson and Liverpool goalkeeper Simon Mignolet both played their 47th game of the season in the 2-0 win over Newcastle United on Monday night. Raheem Sterling opened the scoring in the ninth minute at Anfield before Joe Allen capitalised on a defensive mistake to score his first Anfield goal with 20 minutes to go. Liverpool are four points behind Manchester City.

Roma ended a four-month winless streak at home with a victory over Napoli in Serie A. Miralem Pjanic scored for Roma in the 25th minute. Roma goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis saved multiple shots by Napoli in the second half. Security was tight for Napoli's first visit to Roma since a fan died following a shooting before last season's Italian Cup final. Residents of the Campania region were barred from buying tickets for the match and 1,000 police officers were called in to maintain order.

Doncaster Rovers had an uninspired campaign this season in League One. The match against Fleetwood Town ended in a goalless draw at the Keepmoat Stadium. The media team made the match highlights short, just 27 seconds in fact with 14 seconds of match action, for the club's YouTube channel.

Roland Giroux has a blood parrot cichlid that he interacts with. He cups the fish with his hand inside the tank and massages it. The fish relaxes in his hand and stays still as he strokes it. The fish used to share its tank with two other fish, but he removed them because they were bullying his prized pet. He began interacting with the fish by feeding it frozen blood worms by hand and eventually noticed it becoming more sociable. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid of the midas and the redhead cichlid and was first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

Ben Stokes is back in the England team after a year of ups and downs. He is known as a fiery character, but his aggression needs to be controlled. England wants Stokes in the team as much as possible to help him hit his full potential.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium is a 33,000 sell-out. The two teams will meet at the Cardiff City Stadium on June 12. Wales is in its best position to qualify for a major tournament since the 1958 World Cup. Belgium and Wales both have 11 points from five games. Wales' 3-0 victory in Israel has seen expectations rise that they can claim one of the two automatic qualifying spots for the 2016 finals in France. The Wales squad prefer to play at the Cardiff City Stadium rather than the Millennium Stadium.

John Peacock has named his England squad for next month's UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. The Young Lions are the defending champions and progressed to this edition with a 100 per cent record in qualifying. They have been placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy and the Republic of Ireland and will open their campaign against Italy in Burgas on May 7. The squad contains players from Premier League clubs including Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea and Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi of Arsenal. Their other matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.

Manchester City is interested in signing Anderlecht teenager Evangelos Patoulidis. The 14-year-old playmaker has also attracted attention from Arsenal and Barcelona. He rejected a move to Barcelona when he was 12. Manchester City has held discussions with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old Mexican national who worked as a transgender escort, was found strangled and beaten to death in a flat in Fulham at the end of March. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but has been bailed. Scotland Yard is appealing to anyone who may have had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death.

Dawn, a bereaved mother who suffered seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show and accused her housemate Jamie of stealing £207 set aside for her babies' gravestone. A lie detector test revealed that Jamie had taken the cash. Jamie confessed in a Facebook message that he took the money but blamed it on his girlfriend Carol. Dawn stated she feels betrayed.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, a minority group previously captured when the organization overtook towns in northern Iraq. The released were mostly women and children, with the rest being ill or elderly. Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate the release. The Yazidis were received by Peshmerga and sent to Irbil. 217 or 228 Yazidis were released. ISIS previously released other Yazidis. Yazidis are of Kurdish descent, and their religion is considered a pre-Islamic sect. ISIS' conquest of the town of Sinjar provoked a major humanitarian crisis. ISIS slaughtered Yazidis by the hundreds. The U.S. State Department estimates that 500,000 Yazidis live in northern Iraq.

Harry Kane, the Tottenham sensation, is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season. He features in a new animation, produced by Copa90, which features some of Kane's best goals, and celebrations from the season. The video is entitled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?' and has been released ahead of the awards ceremony on Sunday.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right man to lead Liverpool forward, despite a third straight season without a trophy and a likely finish outside the top four. Carragher believes it was difficult with the players that came in and doesn't think many of them have bedded in yet. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside, providing coaching in eight schools in deprived areas of Merseyside through his 23 Foundation.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport. Security officers took exception to James's toy when it was picked up on the system's X-ray machines and demanded he hand it over. After returning from the holiday to Lanzarote, the four-year-old boy was bought a replacement toy gun. East Midlands Airport apologised for the inconvenience but pointed out they had offered to post the toy back to the family's home in Doncaster, South Yorkshire.

A 31-year-old man named Rich from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree for a girlfriend/wife. He is looking for a non-drinking, non-smoking, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good-with-her-hands, good-cooking, and great-in-bed woman who loves pets and enjoys the outdoors but can also be a princess. Rich is athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs, likes traveling, loves the outdoors, sports, fishing, camping, is 175cm tall, well-endowed, owns property, makes great money, is successful and loves cars and bikes. He is offering accommodation, a possible company car, phone and laptop, free gym membership, and a phone of their choice to the successful candidate and states that he is 'not shy of blowin cash on my woman' and that his potential partner would 'receive lots of benefits'. Former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12. Five former England managers, Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson and Steve McClaren, have signed a letter addressed to Dyke, warning the English game will suffer if the proposals are blocked. Only 36.8 per cent of Premier League starters were eligible for England selection in the last round of matches. The former England managers believe that the pool of English talent playing at the very top level is shrinking and that young players are not being offered opportunity.

Demelza Poldark is now the mother to a baby daughter. Within ten minutes of tomorrow night’s episode, fans will see Ross Poldark gaze lovingly at his new baby daughter. The timeline of the pregnancy is not convincing, with the last month of her pregnancy passing quickly. Fans have noticed the fast relationship.

Leicester manager Nigel Pearson has urged his players to focus on their own job and not worry about their relegation rivals. Leicester host Swansea on Saturday just three points from safety after back-to-back wins.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara completed the longest migration of a mammal ever recorded, swimming nearly 14,000 miles. She traveled from Russia's Sakhalin Island across the Pacific Ocean to Baja, Mexico, visiting three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales. This suggests that some western gray whales may actually be eastern grays.

Overnight, 1,000ft of seabed rose to the surface on the east coast of Hokkaido Island in Japan, near the town of Rausu. The stretch of coastline on Shiretoko Peninsula has risen as high as 50ft in some places. Geologists believe the emergence is a result of a landslide nearby, when melting ice and snow caused a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air. The mass measures roughly 1,000- 1,640ft long, and 100ft wide. Local residents felt no tremors overnight, or heard any sounds to indicate movement. Authorities do not expect it to expand further and it is not believed to be related to the earthquake that struck the Kathmandu Valley.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied claims that he is set to leave Paris Saint-Germain in the summer and reiterated his love for the club. Van der Wiel had a recent falling out with his boss Laurent Blanc after being dropped for the Champions League clash against Chelsea. He told L'Equipe that he is happy at PSG and wants to sign a new contract. The Parisians continue to be linked with Barcelona star Dani Alves, so it remains to be seen whether Van der Wiel has any choice in staying with the club.

Carlos Tevez has been told to terminate his contract with Juventus to return to Boca Juniors in Argentina. His contract with Juventus does not expire until the end of next season, but he wants to leave this summer. Boca Juniors have confirmed they are close to completing a deal for the 31-year-old, but he must first terminate his contract with Juventus. He joined Boca's youth academy in 1996 and scored 26 league goals in 76 appearances before joining Corinthians in 2005. Juventus have accepted that Tevez wants to leave and have started identifying potential replacements. Tevez has netted 17 times this season.

During Bayern Munich's 6-1 victory over Porto, Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped a hole in his trousers. Guardiola's underwear was on show after the incident. Bayern booked a place in the Champions League semi-finals thanks to goals by Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso and a brace from Robert Lewandowski.

On Wednesday afternoon, a multi-vehicle crash involving three vehicles occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, injuring ten people, including four children. A 40-year-old man and a five-year-old boy were flown to Princess Alexandra Hospital, while a 27-year-old woman and a six-year-old girl were also being flown out. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital. One person was trapped in their vehicle and freed by emergency crews. The highway has been closed off with diversions in place south of Fernvale.

Arsenal is hosting Chelsea this weekend, and Arsenal playmaker Mesut Ozil showed off his new Apple Watch on Instagram. Ozil compared the watch to Michael Knight's watch from Knight Rider. Jack Wilshere was on the bench in their FA Cup semi-final win over Reading after five months out through injury. Ray Parlour believes that Wilshere's fitness record is the one thing holding him back from reaching his potential in the Arsenal midfield.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby, despite having sent off three players from United and City this season. Clattenburg sent off City captain Vincent Kompany during the international break. Clattenburg has only shown two red cards this season, both to United players. Assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin will join Clattenburg on Sunday, while Jonathan Moss will serve as the fourth official.

Bob Katter accused the Queensland Government of believing Billy Gordon was 'a little black puppet on a string' after Mr. Gordon was accused of domestic violence. Mr. Gordon was forced to quit the Queensland Labor Party. Mr. Katter has defended the statement, saying he used the term black puppet in light of his personal experiences. The statement has sparked criticism on social media, with some users questioning his terminology.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy and is creating dancing videos to inspire others. She hopes to change how people with disabilities are represented in television, film, and the fashion industry and counteract stereotypes about disabilities. Dayna has also begun motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City has expressed interest in Javier Hernandez, who would be a huge commercial draw for the Florida-based franchise. Orlando has a large Latin-American fanbase. Eight European sides are also interested in Hernandez, including Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio and Inter Milan. Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to Andreas Pereira, who has interest from Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven and Feyenoord.

Around 12:15am on Saturday, at least three people poured gasoline on a white Dodge Charger at a South Los Angeles gas station and set it on fire. The driver had been pumping gas and got into an argument with the suspects, who tried to carjack him. There were two passengers inside the car at the time. No one was injured, but the car was completely ruined. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson and the suspects remain at large.

An Iowa chiropractor, Charles Manuel, surrendered his state license after admitting to accepting sex as payment for his services and performing exorcisms on patients. He signed an agreement pledging not to apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years and must prove the circumstances surrounding the revocation no longer exist before resuming practice. Despite his misdeeds, he received positive patient satisfaction evaluations on HealthGrades.com.

The United States is complaining to Moscow about an incident earlier this week where a Russian fighter jet intercepted a U.S. reconnaissance plane in an "unsafe and unprofessional manner." On Tuesday, a U.S. RC-135U was flying over the Baltic Sea when it was intercepted by a Russian SU-27 Flanker. The Pentagon said the incident occurred in international airspace north of Poland. The U.S. crew believed the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional due to the aggressive maneuvers it performed in close proximity to their aircraft and its high rate of speed," according to Pentagon spokesman Mark Wright. The Pentagon and State Department will "file the appropriate petition through diplomatic channels" with Russia. This is not the first time the U.S. has complained about an incident involving a RC-135U and a SU-27.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot just days before President Obama visited Utah. The gun was inside a hard rifle case and was 'secured properly' to a truck safe with padlocks and chains while the car was parked at the Marriott Springhill Suites. The thief broke the rear right passenger-side window, tied a rope around the rifle case's handle or a cable lock, and used the momentum from another vehicle to then break the case's handle free from the lock. The FBI agent also reported that his gear bag, backpack, and some clothing and tools were also stolen during the March 27 theft. The agent's bags and some of his clothing were found at a Residence Inn across the street, but the sniper rifle has not been recovered. The hotel does not have surveillance cameras, according to the police report.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of murdering his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody in July 2012. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen believes Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder. Costa's state of mind is critical to the case, as the jury can return a not guilty verdict if his unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Ross Barkley missed a 10th minute penalty in Everton's match against Burnley, which they won 1-0. Leighton Baines, who has scored 15 penalties from 16 attempts in the Premier League, did not take the penalty. Martinez said that Barkley was within his rights to request penalty-taking duties and that Baines was happy to give him that responsibility. Tom Heaton, the Burnley goalkeeper, saved Barkley's penalty. Mirallas scored the only goal of the game after 29 minutes.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the Holland America Line cruise ship ms Ryndam in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and it appears to be a murder-suicide. The FBI is investigating, and the ship had left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 for a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise.

Patrick Kluivert, former Holland forward and assistant coach, has made a winning start in World Cup qualifying as coach of Curacao. Curacao advanced to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament. Curacao drew 2-2 in a second-leg match at Montserrat to win 4-3 on aggregate. Curacao face Cuba in the next round, on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso has won all the major European competitions but says that keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would be up there with the best. Cambiasso says that helping keep Leicester in the Premier League will feel like winning a trophy. Cambiasso signed for the Foxes in the summer on a one-year deal. Cambiasso is happy and could stay beyond his current one-year-deal.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children by her own mother, Debbie. Debbie has been caring for Gemma's children since they were four months old, after social services threatened to take them away. Debbie is threatening to ban Gemma because of her drinking, partying, use of legal highs, and suspicion of stealing. Debbie claims Gemma stole an iPad from one of the children to fund her lifestyle. Debbie says Gemma's children call her mum and not grandma.

Chelsea forward Eden Hazard scored to give his side a 1-0 lead against Manchester United at Stamford Bridge. The Sky Sports punditry team believed that there had been a foul in the build-up. Chelsea captain John Terry had come in with a strong challenge from behind on United striker Radamel Falcao which sent the Colombian hurtling to the ground. Blues midfielder Cesc Fabregas then collected the loose ball and released it to Oscar before his back-heel sent it into the path of the oncoming Hazard to score. Pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp and Graeme Souness agreed during their half-time analysis that play should have been stopped for Terry's rough tackle on Falcao.

On Thursday morning, Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway, but everyone was safely evacuated. The bus stopped and burst into flames after a rear tire blew out. The fire destroyed everything in the bus's back lounge except her Bible. Hillary Scott, her husband, the tour manager, and the driver were all evacuated safely. The band's other members, Charles Kelley and Dave Haywood, were not traveling on the bus.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman of Dundee University is working on a laser that will convert sun beams into energy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to harvest sunlight and convert it into laser light, which can be shot back down to earth. If successful, solar power could become viable in Scotland or restore power to disaster-hit areas. Initial trials were successful, and Dr. Quarterman hopes to move trials to Portugal. Researchers in Tokyo have proposed a laser system attached to the ISS to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth's orbit. Dr. Quarterman acknowledged that there might be concerns about who controls his satellites.

Stephen Munden, 54, a convicted paedophile with an obsession with young girls, has gone on the run after vanishing from a psychiatric unit near Hook, Hampshire. He was last seen leaving a hospital at 6.15pm on Tuesday. Munden was detained under the Mental Health Act after sexually touching a three-year-old girl. He is described as about 5ft 8ins tall, of a heavy build, and has dark hair. He may have shaved off his beard before leaving the hospital. He suffers from learning difficulties.

Donald Sterling's former female companion, V. Stiviano, has been ordered to pay back more than $2.6 million in gifts after Donald Sterling's wife, Rochelle "Shelly" Sterling, sued her. Shelly Sterling accused Stiviano of targeting wealthy older men and claimed that Donald Sterling used the couple's money to buy Stiviano a Ferrari, two Bentleys, a Range Rover, and helped her get a $1.8 million duplex. The gifts also included a $391 Easter bunny costume, a $299 two-speed blender and a $12 lace thong. Donald Sterling's racist remarks surfaced after an audio recording of him arguing with Stiviano was posted by TMZ. NBA Commissioner Adam Silver banned Sterling from the league, fined him $2.5 million, and terminated his ownership rights in the franchise.

Thierry Henry has criticised Arsenal's recent dealings in the transfer window. He believes that Arsenal need to buy four players: a goalkeeper, a centre back, a defensive midfielder, and a top quality striker. Henry also claimed that the Gunners will struggle to win the league if Olivier Giroud remains the club's first choice striker.

A young woman abused for years by Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn told a court of the severe impact the abuse had on her life. Van Ryn pleaded guilty to 12 sex offenses, including persistent sexual abuse of a child. The victim stated she is scared for her future relationships and didn't understand why she was targeted. She didn't speak up about the abuse until she heard he had been caught. She has suffered depression since she was 14 and had been hospitalised for self harm and attempted suicide.

Serge Gnabry is feeling better as he prepares to return after being out for more than a year due to a serious knee injury. Gnabry last played in March 2014 against Bayern Munich. He played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading on Monday.

Jacob Phillips, a 23-year-old graduate, died after falling down a 70ft cliff in Penarth, South Wales. He and his friends ran from a taxi to avoid paying the fare after a night out in Cardiff. Phillips was found dead on the rocky beach at the base of the cliff the next day. The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death, stating Phillips was likely disorientated and unaware of the danger.

Thousands of holidaymakers caught up in last summer’s passport delay fiasco have not received any compensation, even though the passport agency made a £42 million profit during the chaos and managers received up to £3,500 in bonuses. Problems began a year ago as HM Passport Office struggled to cope with 3.6 million Britons applying for documents, and by mid-June there were more than half a million passports stuck in the system. In total just 2,191 compensation applications were approved between April last year and January this year, with the total paid out £203,066, an average sum of £92.68. Ministers rejected a demand by the Home Affairs Select Committee for all those left out of pocket to be compensated. HM Passport Office made a surplus of £42.3 million between April and October last year, and in 2013-14 managers were handed a total of £1.8 million in bonuses, with the average reward £499 and the highest £3,500.

A timewarp home in Horfield, Bristol, unchanged since the 1930s, is for sale with original features like stained-glass windows and retro food jars. The semi-detached property, with a guide price between £200,000 and £250,000, includes the original bathroom, kitchen, wood-panelled hallway, and vintage cupboards. The house will be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Colin Kaepernick became the 49ers' starting quarterback in 2012 after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, where they lost to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth `` Babyface '' Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds and Robert Teitel and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans, lived in Texas, and later moved to San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mi freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey, that connects the New Jersey Turnpike to New York State Route 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network owned by Comcast through NBCUniversal.

Damon Albarn, raised in East London and Essex, formed Blur with Graham Coxon, releasing their debut album Leisure in 1991. Blur's self-titled debut album was released in 2001 to worldwide success. Albarn's debut solo album Everyday Robots, co-produced by Richard Russell, was released on April 28, 2014, featuring collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan, and the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir, and sampling Lord Buckley.
Mogadishu, also known as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. Many important national institutions are based in Mogadishu.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by Nine Inch Nails from the Broken EP (1992).
Andrew Kevin Walker, born August 14, 1964, is an American BAFTA-nominated screenwriter.

Shooter (2007 film): Bob Lee Swagger (Mark Wahlberg) is framed for murder by a rogue secret private military company unit.
Shooter (TV series): Bob Lee Swagger (Ryan Phillippe) is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
House is an American television medical drama that ran on Fox for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004 to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder in 1971 for the deaths of seven people: Abigail Ann Folger, Wojciech Frykowski, Steven Earl Parent, Sharon Tate Polanski, Jay Sebring, and Leno and Rosemary La Bianca. He also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald `` Shorty '' Shea. After being charged, recordings of songs written and performed by him were released commercially.

Sean Justin Penn (born August 17, 1960) is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television in 1974 and his film debut was in the drama Taps (1981). He earned his first Academy Award nomination for Dead Man Walking (1995). Penn won his first Academy Award for Best Actor in 2003 for Mystic River and a second one in 2008 for Milk.

Sir Donald George `` Don '' Bradman, born on 27 August 1908 and died on 25 February 2001, was an Australian cricketer, widely acknowledged as the greatest batsman of all time. After retiring, Bradman remained pre-eminent in the game as an administrator, selector, and writer for three decades.
L.A. Reid has served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk is best known as the drummer of Rage Against the Machine (1991-2000; 2007-11) and Audioslave (2001-07). He started his career as a drummer for Greta in 1990 and co-founded Rage with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in August 1991. As of 2016, he is playing in Prophets of Rage. Rage is also a German heavy metal band formed in 1984 by Peter `` Peavy '' Wagner.

The multi-camera series The Millers aired 34 episodes over two seasons on CBS from October 3, 2013, to July 18, 2015. CBS canceled The Millers on November 14, 2014, four episodes into the show's second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards (born September 1, 1933, died September 13, 2006) was an American politician and the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat who first came to national attention as the state treasurer of Texas, when she delivered the keynote address at the 1988 Democratic National Convention. She was defeated for re-election in 1994 by George W. Bush. She was the second female governor of Texas, and was frequently noted in the media for her outspoken feminism and her one-liners. Ann Richards (born October 1, 1935, died April 1, 1982) was an American jazz singer and the wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Drake Bell released an EP in 2011 called A Reminder independently.

The passage discusses the 1979 American drama film "Boardwalk" written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. It also mentions Janet Leigh (1927-2004), an American actress, singer, dancer, and author who wrote four books.

Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Palacios, also known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who played a leading role in the establishment of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama as sovereign states, independent of Spanish rule.

The Bermuda Triangle, also known as the Devil's Triangle, is a loosely-defined region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean, where a number of aircraft and ships are said to have disappeared under mysterious circumstances.

Colin Kaepernick became the 49ers' starting quarterback in 2012. He led the 49ers to the Super Bowl, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. In 2013, Kaepernick helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship, losing to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is an audio or visual marketing communication using a nonpersonal message to promote or sell a product, service, or idea. It is communicated through mass media such as newspapers, magazines, Television, Radio, outdoor advertising, direct mail, search results, blogs, websites, or text messages.
Private Lives is a 1930 comedy of manners in three acts by Noël Coward and a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.
Maurice Harold Macmillan, 1st Earl of Stockton, was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from January 10, 1957, to October 19, 1963.

Aristotle was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist born in Stagira, Chalkidice. He joined Plato's Academy in Athens at seventeen or eighteen and remained there until the age of thirty-seven. Shortly after Plato died, Aristotle left Athens and tutored Alexander the Great at the request of Philip II of Macedon beginning in 343 BC.
David Mordechai Packouz, born in 1982, is an American former arms dealer, musician, inventor, and entrepreneur. He invented the BeatBuddy and is currently the CEO of Singular Sound.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. After winning championships in high school and college, Johnson was selected first overall in the 1979 NBA draft by the Lakers. He won a championship and an NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award in his rookie season, and won four more championships with the Lakers during the 1980s. After protests from his fellow players, he retired again for four years, but returned in 1996, at age 36, to play 32 games for the Lakers before retiring for the third and final time. Named by Ebony magazine as one of America 's most influential black businessmen in 2009, Johnson has numerous business interests, and was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years.

Tenacious D is an American comedy rock duo that was formed in Los Angeles, California in 1994. It is composed of Jack Black and Kyle Gass. The band has released three albums and first gained popularity in 1997 when they starred in their eponymous television series and began to support large rock acts.

James VI and I, born on 19 June 1566 and died on 27 March 1625, was King of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until his death. Scotland and England were individual sovereign states, with their own parliaments, judiciary, and laws, though both were ruled by James in personal union. He faced great difficulties in England, including the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and repeated conflicts with the English Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming eighteenth series of the British reality television series Big Brother, hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley. Bentley is most famous for narrating the United Kingdom's version of Big Brother since its inception in 2000.

The Free State of Saxony is a landlocked federal state of Germany, bordering other federal states and the countries of Poland and the Czech Republic. It is the tenth largest of Germany's sixteen states, with an area of 18,413 km2, and the sixth most populous, with 4 million people. Saxony is a region for quality wine in Germany and one of the northernmost wine regions in Europe.
East End Park is a former major league baseball park located in Cincinnati. "In the End" is a song by Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown began her solo career when she released ``I Want You Back'' with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and the younger sister of Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai, starring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah. It was released on July 1, 1994, and became the second highest-grossing Indian film of 1994. The film received nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Raveena Tandon replaced Divya Bharti in the lead female role after Bharti's death. The film is also remembered for its chart-topping songs.
`` Hourglass '' is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure and singer-songwriter James Taylor 's fourteenth studio album.

Shane Black, born in 1961, is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor. He is known for writing the 1987 film Lethal Weapon and his directorial debut with the 2005 film Kiss Kiss Bang Bang.
A View to a Kill (1985) is the fourteenth James Bond spy film, and the seventh and last to star Roger Moore as James Bond.

Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, comprising most of western New Guinea. It was formerly called Irian Jaya, and before that West Irian or Irian Barat, and comprised all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus probably died from natural causes, although there were unconfirmed rumors that his wife Livia poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez entered the music industry in 1999 with her album On the 6. In 2001, she was the first woman to have a number one album and film in the same week. Her relationship with Ben Affleck influenced her third album. She married Marc Anthony and had twins in 2008. In 2011, she returned to prominence as a judge on American Idol and with her single ``On the Floor''.

Working animals are usually domesticated animals trained to perform tasks. They can be family members like guide dogs, provide tractive force like draft horses, or be used for milking or herding. Wild animals may be trained on rare occasions for novelty or entertainment.

Billboard Dad is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film, directed by Alan Metter starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Top Latin Albums is a record chart published by Billboard magazine for Spanish language albums in the American music market. The Regional Mexican Albums is a genre-specific record chart published weekly by Billboard magazine in the United States.

Vedam is a 2010 Telugu language Indian drama film written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi, starring Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, Anushka Shetty, Manoj Bajpayee, Saranya Ponvannan, Deeksha Seth, Lekha Washington, and Siya Gautham.

Men in Black II, stylized as MIIB, is a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub, and Rip Torn.

Sancho Panza is a fictional character in the novel Don Quixote written by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra in 1605. Sancho acts as Don Quixote's squire and provides comments throughout the novel that are a combination of humour, proverbs, and wit.
The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a 2002 Australian-American science fiction action comedy film starring Eddie Murphy and directed by Ron Underwood.
Hedda Gabler premiered on January 31, 1891, at the Residenztheater in Munich. Ibsen was present at the world premiere.
Brazzers is a pornographic production company based in Montreal, Canada.
Timothy Simon Roth, born on May 14, 1961, is an English actor and director.

Juventus Football Club, known as Juve, is a professional Italian football club based in Turin, Piedmont. Founded in 1897 by young Torinese students, including first president Eugenio Canfari and his brother Enrico. The club has worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903 and plays its home matches in the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis played supporting and minor roles in several films and television series in the late 1990s and early 2000s, including the films Kate & Leopold (2001) and Far from Heaven (2002), and the television series Law & Order: Special Victims Unit.

Jenna Jameson, born on April 9, 1974, is an American entrepreneur, webcam model, and former pornographic film actress. She has been called the world's most famous adult entertainment performer and "The Queen of Porn". She started in erotic videos in 1993 after working as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans are a National Basketball Association (NBA) team that competes in the Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) and later World Championship Wrestling (WCW). It was originally broadcast via closed-circuit television and eventually via pay-per-view television. From the 1960s to the 1980s, Jim Crockett Promotions (JCP) held major professional wrestling events on Thanksgiving and Christmas, mostly at Greensboro Coliseum. Starrcade (1985) was the third annual Starrcade event produced by JCP under the NWA banner, and Starrcade (1987) was the fifth. Starrcade (1997) was the fifteenth annual Starrcade professional wrestling pay-per-view event.
Jack Ryan Falahee, born February 20, 1989, is an American actor known for his roles as Connor Walsh in How to Get Away with Murder and Benjamin Stringfellow in Mercy Street.

Seohyun, born Seo Ju-hyun on June 28, 1991, is a South Korean singer and actress who debuted in August 2007 as a member of Girls' Generation. She debuted as a solo artist on January 17, 2017, with her debut mini album, Do n't Say No.

The Apple II is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak. It was manufactured by Apple Computer and introduced in 1977. Stephen Gary Wozniak co-founded Apple Inc.

A&E is an American cable and satellite television channel. It is the flagship television property of A&E Networks, a joint venture between the Hearst Corporation and Disney -- ABC Television Group subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company. Both maintain a 50% ownership interest.

L.A. Reid has been the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group. He was also the founder and CEO of Hitco Music Publishing and the co-founder of LaFace Records.

Veeram is the title of two Indian films. One is a 2014 Tamil action film directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions. The other is a 2016 epic historical drama film written and directed by Jayaraj.

Home for the Holidays is a 1972 American made-for-television horror film directed by John Llewellyn Moxey, produced by Aaron Spelling, and starring Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter and Walter Brennan which premiered on ABC on November 28, 1972. There is also a 1995 film called Home for the Holidays starring Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton and David Strathairn.
Taran Hourie Killam, born April 1, 1982, is an American actor, comedian, and writer.

Christa McAuliffe took a teaching position as a social studies teacher at Concord High School in New Hampshire in 1983.

Reign Over Me is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder, and produced by his brother Jack Binder. Distributed by Columbia Pictures, the film was released on March 23, 2007.

Sheryl Lee appeared in Café Society in 2016 and reprised her role of Laura Palmer in the Showtime revival of Twin Peaks (2017). Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in Wicked on Broadway in 2016.

Selena Gomez released the song ``Same Old Love'' from her second studio album, Revival, in 2015. The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, and the singles ``Good for You,'' ``Same Old Love,'' and ``Hands to Myself'' all topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the United States.
Weekly Idol is hosted by Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and the United States. Bands in the new wave of British heavy metal such as Iron Maiden and Saxon followed in a similar vein, beginning in the late 1970s.
Ashton Kutcher appeared in the romantic comedies Guess Who (2005), A Lot Like Love (2005), What Happens in Vegas (2008), and No Strings Attached (2011).

Topman is a chain of high-street men's clothing stores located throughout the United Kingdom and has a presence on just about every UK High Street, and in Ireland main street outlets in six cities and towns. YouTube is an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California. It is ranked as the second most popular site in the world by Alexa Internet.
Sidse Babett Knudsen, born on November 22, 1968, is a Danish actress who works in theatre, television, and film.

Asylum Records is an American record label founded in 1971 by David Geffen and Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American computer-animated fantasy television series created for Netflix by Guillermo del Toro and produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Armenian Genocide, also known as the Armenian Holocaust, was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians, mostly Ottoman citizens within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey. Other indigenous and Christian ethnic groups such as the Assyrians and the Ottoman Greeks were similarly targeted for extermination by the Ottoman government in the Assyrian genocide and the Greek genocide.
Marcus Morgan Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist born on October 4, 1967.
William Jefferson Clinton, born August 19, 1946, served as the 42nd President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. His first inauguration was held on January 20, 1993.

Danny Boyle, born on 20 October 1956, is an English director, producer, screenwriter, and theatre director known for his work on films including Shallow Grave, Trainspotting, The Beach, 28 Days Later, Sunshine, Slumdog Millionaire, 127 Hours, and Steve Jobs. Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand was an officer in the British Army. He was born on 22 January 1917 and died on 11 June 2006.

Morse code is a method of transmitting text information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks that can be directly understood without special equipment. The length of each character varies approximately inversely to its frequency of occurrence in English. Compared to voice, Morse code is less sensitive to poor signal conditions, yet still comprehensible to humans without a decoding device. In an emergency, Morse code can be sent by improvised methods, making it one of the simplest and most versatile methods of telecommunication.

Vietnam, officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, is the easternmost country on the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia. Since 2000, Vietnam's economic growth rate has been among the highest in the world. Vietnam remains one of the world's four remaining one-party socialist states officially espousing communism.
Dreamer is a 2005 American sports drama film written and directed by John Gatins in his directorial debut.

Bhagat Singh was a charismatic Indian socialist revolutionary. His acts of violence against the British and execution at age 23 made him a folk hero of the Indian independence movement. He became a popular folk hero after his death.
Aparshakti Khurana made his Bollywood debut in the 2016 Indian Hindi-language biographical sports drama film ``Dangal,'' directed by Nitesh Tiwari and starring Aamir Khan.

James VI and I, born on 19 June 1566 and died on 27 March 1625, was King of Scotland as James VI from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland as James I from 24 March 1603 until his death. Scotland and England were individual sovereign states, with their own parliaments, judiciary, and laws, though both were ruled by James in personal union. He faced many difficulties with Parliament during his reign in England.

Danielle Cormack, born on December 26, 1970, is a New Zealand stage and screen actress. She is known for her roles in Shortland Street, Xena: Warrior Princess, The Cult, Legend of the Seeker, Separation City, Rake, Underbelly: Razor, and Wentworth. She starred in Wentworth for four years before leaving in 2016.
Rob Sheridan, born October 11, 1979, is an American graphic designer, director, and photographer known for his work with Nine Inch Nails.

David Spade starred and co-starred in the films Tommy Boy, Black Sheep, Joe Dirt, Joe Dirt 2: Beautiful Loser, Grown Ups, and Grown Ups 2, among others. Joe Dirt 2: Beautiful Loser is a 2015 American comedy film directed by Fred Wolf and written by David Spade and Fred Wolf.
Angela Evelyn Bassett, born August 16, 1958, is an American actress.

Artpop received mixed reviews from critics but was commercially successful, debuting at number one on the Billboard 200 with 258,000 first-week sales. It was Gaga's second consecutive number-one record in the United States, selling 757,000 copies and was the ninth best-selling album of 2013 with 2.3 million copies sold worldwide.
John Frusciante released his fifth and final album with the Chili Peppers, Stadium Arcadium, in 2006. He departed from the band in 2009.

Margaret Thatcher, as Prime Minister, implemented policies known as Thatcherism. She is a controversial figure, lauded as one of the greatest and most influential politicians in British history, even as arguments over Thatcherism persist.
Duff McKagan, born February 5, 1964, is an American musician, singer, songwriter, and author. He has also written weekly columns for SeattleWeekly.com, Playboy.com, and ESPN.com.
Tom Baker is an English actor who has narrated commercials, video games, audiobooks, and television series.

Valencia is the capital of the autonomous community of Valencia and the third largest city in Spain after Madrid and Barcelona, with around 800,000 inhabitants in the administrative centre. It is Spain's third largest metropolitan area, with a population ranging from 1.7 to 2.5 million.
Buffy Summers was portrayed by Kristy Swanson in the film and later by Sarah Michelle Gellar in the television series.
The TV series Make It or Break It ended on May 14, 2012, with the third season being its final season. This announcement was made on April 26, 2012.

Speech recognition is an inter-disciplinary sub-field of computational linguistics that develops methodologies and technologies that enables the recognition and translation of spoken language into text by computers. Speech recognition applications include voice user interfaces such as voice dialing, call routing, domotic appliance control, search, simple data entry, preparation of structured documents, speech-to-text processing, and aircraft. Many speech industry players have publicized the core technology in their speech recognition systems as being based on deep learning.

Richard Alf (January 26, 1952 – January 4, 2012) was an American businessman and former comic book store owner who co-founded the San Diego Comic-Con International. He served as its chairman beginning in 1970. It was founded as the Golden State Comic Book Convention in 1970 by Shel Dorf, Richard Alf, Ken Krueger and Mike Towry. Later, it was called the `` San Diego Comic Book Convention ''.
Fist of Legend is a remake of the 1972 film Fist of Fury, which starred Bruce Lee.

Dubuisson of France tied with Van Zyl of South Africa at 16 under par. McIlroy carded a 67 to move to 15 under par with Kiradech Aphibarnrat of Thailand. McIlroy is trying to win his first title since May. McIlroy is targeting a third Race to Dubai title in four years and leads Danny Willett by 271,214 points. Chris Wood is fifth and Richard Bland is seventh.

Sheikh Ali Salman told the BBC that the government needs to offer "concrete solutions" for national dialogue to be meaningful and that they want someone who can speak for the royal family. He also stated that now was the time for dialogue and that dialogue and negotiations are necessary. He also noted that he was hopeful that John Kerry would "do more than his predecessor", Hillary Clinton, and that the US government needs to pressure harder for human rights and democratic practices. He also stated that al-Wefaq would continue to call for "peaceful demonstrations" and called for the release of 13 opposition leaders and human rights activists.

Christopher Hogwood died at his home in Cambridge following an illness lasting several months. His funeral will be private, with a memorial service to be held at a later date. Hogwood founded the Academy of Ancient Music (AAM) in 1973 and directed the academy across six continents for some 30 years. He was considered one of the most influential exponents of the early-music movement.

In the year ending in March, there were 57 homicide victims, which is down five from the previous year and the lowest since 1976. As of March 31, 2016, only one homicide case from 2015-16 was unresolved. Sharp instruments were the most common method of killing, with knives being used in 26 out of 29 cases. 31% of accused individuals were under the influence of alcohol or drugs. There is concern that last year's similar drop was revised upwards, and sexual crime and violent crime have increased.

Bournemouth lost 2-1 to Sunderland, making them the first team to lose to them in the Premier League this season. Dan Gosling's goal was their first for three games. Bournemouth were stunned by goals for Sunderland from Victor Anichebe and a Jermain Defoe penalty and they were unable to find an equaliser, even against 10 men following Steven Pienaar's dismissal.

Australia detains migrants trying to reach its shores by boat and takes them to offshore processing camps. The New York Times described this policy as "brutal" and "inhumane". Mr. Abbott said that the only way to prevent people dying at sea was to "stop the boats," and that Australia has stopped deaths by stopping illegal boats. Mr. Abbott angered Australian Jewish groups by saying IS was worse than the Nazis, a comment he later stood by.

Washington blamed Russia and the Syrian government for intensifying attacks against civilians and is suspending its participation in bilateral channels with Russia. Russia regrets the US move, accusing it of shifting the blame for the collapse of last month's truce and says that the US did not fulfill the agreement to improve humanitarian conditions around Aleppo. The US and Russia will keep talking about counter-terrorism operations in Syria.

Downing Street supported a Policy Exchange report stating that selling high-value vacant homes could raise £4.5bn a year, enough to build 80,000 to 170,000 social homes. Policy Exchange argues this could create the largest social house building program since the 1970s and reduce the number of people waiting for social housing by about 500,000. According to Policy Exchange, expensive social housing accounts for 21.8% of the total social housing stock in the UK, equating to 816,000 properties that could raise up to £159bn if sold. Critics of the plan say it would push the least well-off out of expensive streets and into new ghettos.

Gareth Colfer-Williams, 25, died last week at his home in Swansea, the city at the centre of a measles epidemic of 942 cases. The examination was unable to establish whether measles was the main cause of his death and further tests are needed. Since the outbreak began in November, 83 people have needed hospital treatment for the illness. Mr. Colfer-Williams had recently been treated at Swansea's Morriston Hospital for asthma. He developed a rash and went to see a GP on April 17. The following morning, Mr Colfer-Williams was found dead at his flat. Laboratory tests confirmed a diagnosis of measles, but further tests were needed to determine the cause of death.

Vincent Hudson, 54, of Loweswater Avenue, Whitehaven, has been charged with a historical offence on a boy under 16. The attack was reported to have taken place in 2001. He is due to appear before North Cumbria Magistrates' Court later.
Guiseley went ahead on 15 minutes when Jake Lawlor scored. Gateshead levelled the score on 62 minutes when Wes York scored. The match ended Gateshead 1, Guiseley 1.

Bristol Sport Ltd plans to replace two stands to increase capacity as an alternative to building a new stadium at Ashton Vale. Steve Lansdown confirmed the work would begin at a shareholder meeting on Tuesday. The work was approved by Bristol City Council in November. If there is no judicial review by March, redevelopment plans will commence in May.

Cuadrilla has suspended drilling as a precaution after a 1.5 magnitude tremor, the second in two months. The British Geological Survey (BGS) will examine the data before Cuadrilla decides whether to resume. The BGS said a tremor on April 1 shared a "similar location and mechanism" to the recent one. Mark Miller, chief executive of Cuadrilla Resources, said they have stopped fracking operations to share information and consult with authorities and experts. The BGS is monitoring fracking as a precaution. There have been two small earthquakes in Lancashire since fracking began in March. The BGS said that injecting pressurised water into rocks can cause the rock to fracture and possibly produce earthquakes.

Angus Carpenter, 62, of Liverpool, was found guilty of one count of fraud when he played with a Hillsborough Justice Campaign banner on his bagpipes in April 2015, but was cleared of two other counts. Sgt Chris Gaynor told the court that Carpenter gave the impression he was collecting cash for the Hillsborough Justice Campaign. Carpenter said he had piped for the charity in the past but on this occasion he was simply busking. Kenneth Derbyshire, chairman of the Hillsborough Justice Campaign, said he gave Carpenter permission to display a banner but not to collect funds for the charity. Carpenter said the banner was a tribute to the victims and that he was a familiar face on match days at Anfield. He will be sentenced in January.

Ipswich Town defeated Queens Park Rangers 3-0. Grant Ward, Luke Varney, and Tom Lawrence scored for Ipswich. Sandro hit the post for QPR. The win moved Ipswich up to 14th place, while QPR dropped to 15th.

Wells, 23, scored 373 runs at 28.69 with a strike rate of 138.66 in the T20 Blast last season. Wells said the club is going in the right direction and the environment created by the coaches is of elite performance.
