Laura Muir will not be with the Scotland team at the Commonwealth Games next year because her veterinary medicine exams are in May and the games are in April. She says the World Indoor Championships in March are "potentially a target". At the World Athletics Championships, she finished fourth and sixth in the 1500m and 5,000m.

Trevor Deely, 22, was last seen in December 2000 walking home from a Christmas party. A search of a site in Chapelizod in Dublin started early on Saturday morning. The search will involve excavations and is expected to take a number of weeks. CCTV footage shows Mr. Deely talking to a man dressed in black outside the Bank of Ireland on Baggot Street. Gardaí renewed their appeal for the man to come forward.

- Del Potro beat Wawrinka 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3.
- Del Potro is ranked 165th after missing two years because of injury.
- Del Potro will next play either Lucas Pouille or Donald Young.
- Kyrgios beat Dustin Brown 6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4.
- Lopez will play Kyrgios in the third round.
- Berdych beat Benjamin Becker 6-4 6-1 6-2, while Tsonga triumphed 6-1 6-4 6-3 over Juan Monaco.

Tunisia faced expulsion from the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations until apologising to Caf for complaints lodged during this year's Nations Cup. Morocco were able to enter the 2017 Nations Cup qualifying draw after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (Cas) overturned a ban on its participation. Morocco were punished in February after being replaced as 2015 Nations Cup hosts and the fine imposed on Morocco's FA was reduced from $1m to $50,000 by Cas. Tunisia were leading 1-0 in the 90th minute of their quarter-final against Equatorial Guinea when they were awarded a contentious penalty. Tunisia's 2017 participation seemed in doubt until a meeting with Caf president Issa Hayatou in mid-March led to a resolution. Tunisia will face Togo, Liberia and Djibouti in Group A while Morocco will Cape Verde, Libya and Sao Tome in Group F.

McLaren, a team with a history of 182 grand prix wins, 12 drivers' world championships, and eight constructors' titles, has fallen from past greatness. The slump started in 2013 due to chassis design issues, and now the problem lies with the Honda power-unit. McLaren achieved their greatest successes with Honda, including a dominant 1988 season. The team's last constructors' title was in 1998. In 2007, they were kicked out of the constructors' championship and fined $100m due to illegal possession of Ferrari technical information. Another scandal, 'lie-gate', occurred in 2009. McLaren's F1 history has been a cycle of triumph and decline. Ron Dennis, who helped build the team, insists that success will return. Fernando Alonso returned to the team in 2015 because he felt the renewed Honda partnership was his best chance to win a title.

Paramedics were called to Joe's Bar in Dungiven at 06:00 BST on 6 October 2014, where police found people still at the bar and till receipts showed alcohol was served as late as 04:49 BST. Colleen O'Neill, 43, was charged with two counts of allowing the consumption of liquor outside licensing hours and James Thomas, 44, faced one count of the same charge. The judge ordered the bar's closure for three months, fined Ms. O'Neill £3,000, and fined Mr. Thomas £1,000.

Stephen Curry broke his own NBA record for most 3-pointers in a season, scoring 45 points as the Golden State Warriors beat the Portland Trail Blazers 116-105. Curry hit eight 3-pointers to eclipse his previous NBA best of 272. Elsewhere, Pau Gasol had 16 points and 15 rebounds as the Chicago Bulls beat the Miami Heat 89-78.

YouTube star Bas van Velzen visited Melwood, where Liverpool players Mario Balotelli, Fabio Borini, Rickie Lambert, and Lazar Markovic thought he was a competition winner there to meet them and receive a dead-ball masterclass. Van Velzen showcased his free-kick skills, surprising the Liverpool players. Van Velzen said he enjoyed pretending he wasn't very good at free-kicks and seeing the players' faces when they saw him shoot.

Women diagnosed with breast cancer caused by the BRCA1 gene, like Angelina Jolie, can reduce their risk of death by over 60% if they have their ovaries removed. A study of 676 breast cancer patients with mutated BRCA1 or BRCA2 genes found a 62% drop in breast cancer death in women with a BRCA1 mutation who underwent oophorectomy. The 20-year survival rate for the entire group was 77.4%. Oophorectomy was associated with a 65% reduction in death from all causes. For BRCA1 carriers who had their ovaries removed within two years of diagnosis, there was a 73% reduction in death. The protective effect of oophorectomy against breast cancer was apparent immediately after diagnosis and lasted for 15 years. More research is needed, especially on carriers of the BRCA2 variant.

On Easter Sunday in Durham, North Carolina, Derek Lowe, 38, and Tina Lowe, 33, were struck and killed by an Amtrak train heading north from Charlotte to New York City. The accident occurred on property owned by Norfolk-Southern. There were no injuries to the 166 passengers on the train, but one man received treatment for an illness during the delay. The train was delayed for about two hours and 45 minutes. The couple may have lived in a homeless camp.

Carlos Toro, 66, worked for the DEA as an informant for 27 years after fleeing Colombia. He was promised US citizenship for his work, but has not received it. The DEA refused to help him with citizenship after he went public and now that he has retired due to declining health, he is technically living in the US illegally and faces deportation. Toro fears for his life if he is sent back to Colombia, as his information aided in the prosecution of Carlos Lehder and Manuel Noriega.

The US regulator is looking into whether Vox Populi Registry LTD's '.sucks' domain is being used illegally to extract exorbitant sums from celebrities and companies. Kevin Spacey is among celebrities who've paid to get the domains removed. YouTube, Bing, Visa, Bank of America and Yahoo are among others targeted. Owners recommended reselling '.sucks' domains for around $2,499 a year.

In 1988, a baby boy's body was found in a Sainsbury's bag in a village pond. In 2015, the body was exhumed, and DNA samples led police to the mother, who was arrested on suspicion of infanticide. The charge was dropped after she explained the baby was stillborn, and she had concealed the pregnancy. The baby was reburied and named Peter. Police have ruled out foul play, and the woman remains on bail while the CPS decides whether to charge her with failing to register a birth and preventing a lawful burial.

Kristopher Hicks sustained severe brain injuries after jumping out of a taxi driven by Michael Young, who mistakenly thought Hicks was going to avoid paying the fare. Young decided to drive Hicks back to the taxi rank to "teach him a lesson," leading Hicks to jump from the moving vehicle. The High Court ruled that Young had unlawfully imprisoned Hicks, entitling him to damages, which are set to be around 50% of the family's request. Hicks now requires round-the-clock care due to the injuries and has developed epilepsy.

Tornado sirens blared in Kansas on Wednesday night as storms brought reports of twisters. Spotters reported a tornado about 6 miles northwest of Goddard, less than 15 miles west of Wichita. Other reports of tornadoes came in from southwestern Kansas, near Aetna. The National Weather Service indicated a tornado may have touched down in Potosi, Missouri. On Thursday, more storms are expected in the Midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley, and near the southern Great Lakes.

Luke Rockhold is preparing to fight Lyoto Machida in New Jersey, bidding for his fourth consecutive victory and a title shot. Rockhold plans to dominate Machida by being the "bull" to Machida's "matador," cutting him off and making him fight Rockhold's fight. Machida is confident that if he applies his style and technique, he can defeat Luke.

A light general aviation aircraft approached the Aero Acres residential airpark in Fort Pierce, Florida, and touched down without its landing gear deployed. The plane skidded along the tarmac, its propellers ricocheting off the ground. The pilot re-engaged the engines and took off back into the air. The pilot, Chris Georgaklis, 85, flew 100 miles to Fort Lauderdale and landed safely. The FAA is investigating the incident. The most common cause of a gear-up landing is human error.

Manuel Pellegrini admitted disappointment in Yaya Toure's performance this season but will back him until the end of the season. Manchester City will listen to offers for Toure in the summer. Joe Hart said the players should take responsibility for poor performances. Manchester City wants to sign West Ham left back Aaron Cresswell in the summer, and Sam Allardyce has warned Cresswell not to make the same mistake as other English players by moving to City.

Domenico Rancadore, a Sicilian mafia fugitive, will be allowed to remain in the UK after his seven-year sentence from 1999 was dropped because the case expired last October. Although his conviction remains, Italian law states that a sentence is extinguished once a period of more than double the time of the penalty has passed. The Italian Ministry of Justice confirmed that the decision by the court of appeal in Palermo is appealable to the Italian Supreme Court.

Mr. Mole, ridden by AP McCoy, is a co-favorite in the Grade One Celebration Chase at Sandown on Saturday. Mr. Mole is bracketed with Special Tiara and Sprinter Sacre. This will be McCoy's last ride in a Grade One race. McCoy announced his intention to quit riding after riding Mr. Mole to victory at Newbury in February.

Virginia Trimble Ritter's daughter, Marcia, was raped and choked to death by Jerome Sydney Barrett in 1975. Marcia's body was found 33 days after she disappeared. Ritter recently viewed crime scene photos of her daughter's body after decades of declining to do so, even after Barrett's conviction 33 years later. Jerome Sidney Barrett was found guilty of second-degree murder six years ago and a davidson county criminal court jury imposed a sentence of 44 years. Marcia's body was found 150 yards from her home amid the clutter of a rarely used , windowless garage , under a shower curtain and a child 's wading pool. In 2009 he was found guilty of second-degree murder of Marcia.

Rory McIlroy believes it is ` unthinkable ' that he will not win the Masters to complete the career grand slam. McIlroy is looking to claim his first green jacket and become just the sixth player to win all four major titles. McIlroy says his final-round collapse at Augusta National in 2011 was the most important day of his career. McIlroy hopes he can again use the golf course as his ` sanctuary ' from the pressure surrounding Augusta.

This week's trending stories include four rainbows appearing in the sky after a large amount of rain, exotic dancers being hired to perform at wakes in rural China, and RDJ growing agitated during an interview. A new trend called lip plumping has emerged where people suck on a jar to look like Kylie Jenner, and a 102-year-old woman went back in time with the help of filmmakers. Other trending stories include a prom-posal that referenced bombs, Ewan McGregor playing Lumiere in `Beauty and the Beast', Johnny Depp in the `Black Mass' trailer, an announcement referencing "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air", and a military dad photobombing his son.

New figures show that 272 youngsters left disabled by foetal alcohol syndrome were hospitalised in England over the past 12 months. Research suggests that at least one in 100 babies born in the UK could suffer learning, behavioural, and physical problems because of exposure to alcohol in the womb. Children born with the syndrome do not get better. Niamh Brown, a 15-year-old born with foetal alcohol syndrome, needs help getting dressed, has no sense of danger and will never be able to live independently. Other medical issues associated with alcohol consumption during pregnancy include problems with the liver, kidneys and heart, cerebral palsy, sight loss and epilepsy. Pregnant women are advised by the government not to drink alcohol.

Shaun Andrew McKerry, a 31-year-old ex-juvenile offender, attempted to rob Shildon Post Office and Stores with an axe but was stopped by the shopkeeper and his wife, who hit McKerry with a baseball bat. McKerry was arrested and jailed for six years after pleading guilty to attempted robbery at Durham Crown Court. McKerry earned the nicknames "boomerang boy" or "homing pigeon boy" because he always returned home after committing a crime.

Four Royal Navy sailors are charged with the gang rape of a young woman at an alcohol-fueled party at a Canadian barracks and must stay in Nova Scotia until they have been tried. The four men, Joshua Finbow, Simon Radford, Craig Stoner, and Darren Smalley, were given bail conditions that include surrendering their passports and living at the Stadacona naval base in Halifax. They will continue to work for the Royal Navy and draw their current pay. The alleged sexual assault took place on April 10 after the sailors had returned to the barracks from a hockey game. They were ordered to return to court on May 27 and given the names of seven people who they were forbidden to contact. The four are charged with sexual assault causing bodily harm and group sexual assault, offences that are punishable by up to 14 years in prison.

Valerie Jackson's four-year-old son, RJ Jackson, suffers from Netherton's syndrome, a rare disease that makes his skin appear scalded and causes it to be red and scaly. While out shopping in Las Vegas, Mrs. Jackson was reported to the police for child abuse by a member of the public who mistook RJ's condition for signs of abuse. RJ was diagnosed as a baby after an angry rash was noticed on his chest. There is no cure for Netherton's syndrome.

Campaigners are celebrating the removal of Protein World's "Are you beach body ready?" adverts from the London Underground. The posters, featuring a bikini-clad model, sparked outrage and a petition with over 50,000 signatures. The Advertising Standards Authority received over 200 complaints, and some posters were defaced. Transport for London is removing the posters as the three-week advertising period has ended. Protein World is defending its campaign amidst the backlash, which includes social media outrage, a protest, and even a bomb threat.

Rail firms are planning fare hikes of up to 87 per cent. The prime minister has requested First Great Western (FGW) ` urgently review ' its decision to almost double some fares on the route between London and the Cotswolds. Passengers travelling from Charlbury, can currently purchase an off-peak return to London costing £33.30, but from May 17, these customers will be forced to pay £62.40 if they want to come home on one of these trains - an 87 per cent increase. Other sharp price hikes to be introduced include an off-peak first-class single from Crewe to Northampton on London Midlands, which will rise from £30 to £37 and the cost of an anytime return between Stafford and Liverpool, travelling with Virgin, will leap from £26.50 to £33. Virgin has said the ` vast majority ' of its price hikes affected ` virgin trains-only fares ' - which are at least 20 per cent cheaper than tickets offered by rival firms.

John Young, a 66-year-old former soldier, was blinded in one eye after thugs threw a brick at him when he confronted them for throwing stones at his property in Oldham. The attack occurred just three weeks after he married his wife Elaine, 54. Police have launched an investigation but have no motive and believe it could be yobs "messing around".

Tom Poynton, Derbyshire wicketkeeper, has been rewarded for his successful return from injury by signing a new one-year contract extension. He missed the entire 2014 campaign due to leg injuries sustained in a road accident in which his father died. He made his comeback during Derbyshire's pre-season tour of Abu Dhabi and has committed himself to the county until the end of the 2016 season.

Harley Renshaw, a five-year-old boy, has been given the all-clear from cancer after battling an aggressive form of neuroblastoma for a year. He was diagnosed after complaining of a stomach pain and was found to have cancer in his kidney, neck, lungs, and bones. He underwent 80 days of chemotherapy, an operation, a stem cell transplant, and weeks of radiotherapy. Harley decorated his radiotherapy mask like a ninja turtle to feel stronger during treatment. After his story made headlines, Nickelodeon sent him Ninja Turtle presents. He will undergo regular check-ups.

Tim Sherwood believes Jack Grealish should focus on his Aston Villa career rather than his international future. Sherwood has been impressed with the 19-year-old, who is wanted by the Republic of Ireland and England. Grealish is expected to choose between Ireland and England at the end of the season. Grealish's dad, Kevin, agreed that his son must concentrate on his club football first.

Landing fees for private jets can differ dramatically, with some surprising hubs asking for the highest fees. Private jet travel is a growing trend, with the market worth $16.7 trillion in the US and $15.8 trillion in Europe. The busiest weekends occur during huge sporting events like the Super Bowl and Monaco Grand Prix. Haneda Airport in Tokyo is the most expensive for landing fees at £4,559. The only US airport to make it into the top 10 is LaGuardia, in New York, which charges $3,950.

Katie Gallegos from Clackamas County, Oregon, took Cooper the dog to a McDonald's drive-thru for ice cream with his pal Daisy. While Daisy takes a few licks, Cooper gobbles the rest of the cone up in one bite. Gallegos says that Cooper always eats very quickly, so she always makes sure Daisy gets her fill first. The video of Cooper's ice cream outing has been watched more than seven million times. Another video shows the duo visiting a Starbucks for a `pup-uccino'. Cooper takes the whole cup away in his mouth to demolish the contents. Gallegos notes that the beverage does not contain any coffee and is merely a dollop of `whip cream in a cup'.

Gary Locke, the interim manager, has been given the Kilmarnock job on a permanent basis after signing a three-year deal. He joined as assistant boss last summer and took control of the team when Allan Johnston quit in February. Since taking over, Locke has lost just once in seven games.

Jessica Kemp from Eustis says teachers at Seminole County Elementary threatened to remove her kindergartner son, Logan, from class because the Doterra oils he wears smelled and were a distraction to youngsters around him. The 32-year-old puts the oil on his neck as she believes it keeps him calm and focused. She claims her boy has been using them all year, but then a teacher's aide complained. Kemp said she received a letter from the local school board stating the oils had created a `problem' for staff and students. Despite the threat of punishment, Mrs. Kemp has said she will continue to fight the decision and insists the use of the oils has a positive impact on her son. However, on Thursday, Lake County School District told the station they would not suspend Logan, saying it was a `health issue'. The family uses oils with scents such as lavender, chamomile, and sandalwood.

A fire spread through 90 condos in a beach-side apartment complex in the Hamptons, causing the building to collapse. The fire was so intense it melted the paint off nearby buildings and could be seen from three miles away. Twelve fire crews were deployed but could not get inside. The cause of the blaze is unknown but is being investigated. The building manager who lived and worked in the complex lost everything. The Sandpiper complex is open between May and November.

Approaching her 89th birthday, the 88-year-old Queen was seen riding her black fell pony, Carltonlima Emma, in Windsor Great Park with a groom. She does not wear a helmet, but a silk scarf. She first rode at age four and has had many horses since. She has cut back on riding due to a knee injury, but still takes interest in her horses and ponies. She breeds fell ponies and has a stud specializing in highland ponies. Fell ponies have existed since the neolithic period and were used by the Romans, Vikings, and Normans. They became popular riding horses in the 1950s and are still popular today.

A noise complaint between two Brisbane neighbors resulted in the death of Leon Yeaman, 55. Phillip Pama, 28, allegedly punched Yeaman in the head. Pama was granted conditional bail and the case is due back in court on May 18.

Yulia Simonova, a 52-year-old music teacher, wanted to hire a hitman to torture and murder 15-year-old Damian Vanya after he ended their relationship. Simonova asked a friend to find someone willing to torture and kill Vanya in exchange for 100,000 rubles (£1,400). Police set up a sting operation, where Simonova handed over expense money to an undercover officer posing as a hitman. Simonova was arrested in her car and faces 15 years in prison after being charged with attempted murder.

Jose Mourinho, Chelsea football manager, talks to God every day but never about football and never discusses the game with his wife. He and his family ` know about poverty ' and have been privileged to have worked with the word food programme as an ambassador against hunger . He separates his professional and his family life. He only prays for things in his personal life, never about Chelsea. He claims that he is a good person. Earlier this season , mourinho was fined £ 25,000 by football authorities for claiming there was a ` campaign ' against chelsea. He prays every day but only goes to church regularly in portugal.

Bob Barker, the former host of "The Price is Right" for 35 years, returned to host the show on April 1, after stepping down in 2007. At 91, he hosted the "lucky seven" game before handing hosting duties over to Drew Carey.

An off-duty Secret Service agent, Arthur Baldwin, was arrested in Washington D.C. at 12:30 AM on Friday on a residential street in southeastern D.C. He was charged with felony attempted burglary and destruction of property. The Secret Service revoked Baldwin's security clearance and put him on leave. Baldwin's arrest comes two days after a high-ranking supervisor was put on leave after being accused of misconduct.

Atif Saeed, a freelance photographer from Lahore, Pakistan, risked his life to photograph a hungry lion in a safari park. He got out of his car and approached the lion, armed only with a camera, getting within 10 feet of it. The clicking of the camera alerted the lion, who jumped towards Saeed, who then retreated to his car.

On March 22, an unnamed woman, believed to be between 25 and 45 years old, was discovered unconscious near Shore Parkway and 26th Avenue in Brooklyn and pronounced dead that evening. The NYPD released images of a heart tattoo with the name `Monique' found on the woman's right leg in hopes of identifying her. The police are awaiting a medical examiner's report to find out the cause of death.

Hannah and Alex, a New Zealand couple, built a solar-powered, two-bedroom home on the back of a 1986 Hino flatbed truck after returning from the UK because they could not afford to buy property. The project took a year and a half and cost them about $25,000. They now live self-sufficiently in Nelson, New Zealand.

Researchers found that kindergarten children who shared iPads in class scored around 30 points higher on early literacy tests than students who used the device on their own and non-ipad users. The research was conducted by Courtney Blackwell at Northwestern University in the US, who worked with 352 students at a midwestern suburban school district during the research. Blackwell said it was the collaborative learning around the technology that made the difference. She is due to present her findings at the 65th annual conference of the international communication association in Puerto Rico.

A piglet born without back legs has become an internet sensation after learning to walk on its front trotters. The piglet belongs to Ms. Duan from Qionglai City in Sichuan Province, China. Villagers have flocked to see the animal, and it has been nicknamed "super pig".

During the inaugural IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, Todd Phillips, a tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was injured when he was struck by the car of Francesco Dracone, who had come in on lap 25 for tires and fuel. Dracone spun while exiting his pit box, clipping Phillips' leg. Phillips was taken to the infield care center for treatment where he received stitches for a cut on his leg and was released. Dracone did not finish the race and wound up 23rd.

Milton Vieira Severiano, 32, killed his wife, 29-year-old dancer Cicera Alves de Sena, by smashing her head into concrete 11 times and shooting her in the face five times. He confessed to the murder, stating he was jealous of men looking at her. Severiano stole a neighbor's car but was caught by police after crashing it. Police found four handguns, a shotgun, and a bulletproof vest in the car. He now faces life in jail.

Sarah Wilson, journalist and author of "I Quit Sugar," revealed her battle with mental illness led her to believe her life was not worth living. Wilson said a combination of issues, including mounting stress, anxiety, her thyroid disease and distant family, drove her to this point. Wilson now accepts she is an anxious person and believes anxiety is becoming the new depression.

Elena Curtin of Portland, Oregon, was charged with second-degree assault after she struck her boyfriend's ex in the head and arm with a crowbar in November 2014. Curtin found her boyfriend's ex-girlfriend shooting heroin in her bathroom, and when the woman refused to leave, Curtin beat her with a crowbar. Prosecutors dropped the charge because Curtin was 'completely justified in her outrage'. Oregon law allows for the use of physical force against an intruder who won't leave a resident's home. Curtin's defense attorney said the ex-girlfriend was jealous and bitter and had harassed and threatened Curtin. Curtin has since moved on with her life.

Gemma, a pit bull in California, was filmed being fed treats. Her owner tried to trick her by throwing a broccoli spear into the mix. Gemma looked disgusted and spit the broccoli out. Other videos show that Gemma enjoys sleeping and hanging out with her human family.

In 2011, HSBC scrapped the young entrepreneur awards, and the organizers allowed its registration on hsbc.com.hk to retire. As a result, anyone trying to access the bank's page for the young entrepreneur awards was directed to a pornographic website. HSBC has since removed the hyperlink from its main website and apologized to the public for any inconvenience caused. They stated that HSBC is not associated with the external third-party website and insisted its website remained secure.

On Sunday morning, a 13-year-old Maryland boy called 911 after a fire broke out on the first floor of his family's home in Clinton. Marcus and his nine-year-old sister Aaliyah were trapped in a second-floor bedroom. Marcus stayed calm throughout the 11-minute call, providing directions to the dispatcher. Prince George's County firefighters were able to enter the room and rescue Marcus and his sister. The siblings were taken to children's hospital with non-life threatening injuries, and the three other family members were taken to medstar hospital after escaping on their own.

Blue fluorescent algae have been seen lighting up Australia's east coast in Jervis Bay, on the south coast of New South Wales. Photographer Andy Hutchinson described the sight as a ` beautiful supernatural scene ' caused by millions of plankton omitting light. A similar display was shown in Sydney's Manly Beach back in August 2014. According to Iain Suthers, of University of New South Wales, the glow is caused by noctiluca scintillans, which is a single celled phytoplankton that blossoms in the spring and the autumn. Mr. Suthers explained that the cell gives off the luminous glow as a defense mechanism.

New tests can determine the aggressiveness of a tumor by pinpointing genetic markers, and women can be told within days whether they have a high or low risk of the disease returning. If the newest of the tests, called endopredict, shows a low score, patients can opt not to have chemotherapy. Most of the tests are available only privately and cost about £2,500. Professor Kefah Mokbel said that with this test they can help patients make an informed choice, whereas in the past they have just given chemotherapy to almost everyone. Becca Cornford had a sample of her tumor tested using the endopredict, and a low score meant her chances of recurrence within ten years were just five per cent, and she was told chemotherapy could not offer much better odds.

More than 25 women have been airlifted from royal navy ships due to pregnancy. One ship, HMS Ocean, had five pregnant sailors removed in emergency evacuations during the last nine years. A ministry of defence spokesman confirmed there was a strict ` no touching ' rule in place at sea, which suggests the women conceived before boarding the ships or during leave. Women have been serving on royal navy ships since 1990 and in 2014 around 9 per cent of personnel were female. Nearly 100 female British soldiers were sent home from Afghanistan after finding out they were pregnant. A further 102 women were evacuated from Iraq. Strict military rules ban mothers-to-be from serving in war zones.

A drone carrying traces of radioactive material was found on the roof of the Japanese equivalent to the White House. The drone had a camera, smoke flares, and a plastic bottle containing traces of cesium. The discovery is raising concerns about potential terrorism using drones. There are currently no flight restrictions for drones over most of Tokyo, including the prime minister's residence.

Lu Xincai, a security guard from China, takes his 84-year-old mother to work with him on the back of his motorbike every day because she suffers from Alzheimer's and he is scared she will get lost if he leaves her at home alone. He ties a sash around both of their waists to make sure she doesn't fall off. His employers, a bank, have given his mother her own room.

A study by the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation at the University of Washington found that heavy drinking among Americans rose 17.2 percent between 2005 and 2012, mainly due to rising rates among women. In 2012, 8 percent of Americans were considered heavy drinkers, and 18 percent were binge drinkers. About 88,600 U.S. deaths were attributed to alcohol in 2010, and the cost of excessive drinking has been estimated at more than $220 billion per year. Researchers analyzed data on about 3.7 million Americans aged 21 and older from the behavioral risk factor surveillance system to conduct the study.

UN officials warn that doctors are putting the health of women and their babies at risk by performing caesarean sections too readily. The procedure should only be carried out when medically necessary because it can lead to infections and even death. Just over a quarter of women giving birth in England now have a caesarean, and the rate has more than doubled since the early 1990s. The WHO said that this figure should ideally be between just 10% and 15%, due to the dangers and costs involved. A planned caesarean costs the NHS an average of £2,369, compared to a natural birth at £1,665.

Michelle Filkins, 44, of West Wareham, was arrested on April 17 after Mark Conklin found her in his Edgartown home. Filkins allegedly broke into the home, lived there for at least a week, and sold items belonging to the owners in a yard sale. She has been charged with breaking and entering, larceny over $250, and malicious destruction of property. Police are asking anyone who received items from the home to return them to the Edgartown Police Department or contact them at 508-627-4343. Filkins is scheduled to be in court on May 14.

Bella Crooke from Melbourne lost her iPhone at a friend's birthday party. It was handed in to Albury police station. Police posted selfies and photos of the phone in various locations around the police station on Bella's Facebook page. Bella reclaimed her phone and didn't even have to give her name because officers recognised her from her Facebook page. Bella has since put a password on her phone.

A five-day-old hippopotamus was mauled to death after getting caught in a fight between two adult male hippos in isimangaliso wetland park, eastern South Africa. The calf was thrown in the air and dragged along the water. The calf's mother watched in horror. Stacey Farrell, a tour operator, witnessed the event. The calf died of its injuries hours later.

A three-bedroom apartment in Knightsbridge, London, is on the market for £575,000, a fraction of the price of neighboring homes. The catch is that the property has only three years left on the lease. The cost would work out to be £191,000 per year, or £15,000 per month, which is around the going rate for renting a three-bedroom flat in the area. If a buyer decides to extend the lease, the property could be worth upwards of £6 million. The property is one of two maisonettes being sold with three years remaining on the lease.

Starbucks experienced a computer outage that affected 8,000 stores in the US and Canada, which led to free drinks being given away. The outage was caused by a failure during a daily system refresh and also affected Evolution Fresh and Teavana stores. The issue has been resolved, and stores were expected to open for business as usual on Saturday. The tech issue occurred one day after Starbucks posted record quarterly earnings.

Terrorists are undergoing training in rural areas of west wales, specifically in Ceredigion, Powys, and Pembrokeshire, to radicalise muslims. These individuals participate in ordinary activities but have ulterior motives. Islamic extremist activity in Wales can be traced back to 1998. In 2005, two of the 7/7 bombers were photographed white water rafting in Bala, North Wales. Three would-be terrorists from Cardiff were arrested as part of an al-qaeda inspired gang. Michael Adebowale, one of the men convicted of murdering fusilier lee rigby, studied arabic at the former european institute of human sciences at highmead, near llanybydder.

An Omura's whale, a species that was only described in scientific journals for the first time in 2003, was found on a remote Exmouth beach in Western Australia after a cyclone. It is the first sighting of the species in WA and only the second in Australia. The 5.68 m juvenile female was identified using DNA profiling. The find was highly significant for whale scientists because very little was known about the species. The species is usually found in Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. Omura's whales have a sleek body shape and several unique skeletal features, including 53 vertebrae. The carcass has been buried and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and possibly for public display in museums.

A businesswoman in Texas believes Hillary Clinton's hormones might make her irrational and start an unnecessary war. The author argues that men's hormones have historically impaired leaders' decision-making and that studies show women leaders take fewer unnecessary risks. The author contends that bias against women in the workplace is well-established, and even in 2015, a female candidate will be hard-pressed to get elected unless we have a serious discussion about ending gender bias.

Robert Hardy, known for his roles in All Creatures Great and Small and as Winston Churchill, is selling his collection of over 200 antiques in a £100,000 auction due to downsizing. The auction includes a diorama of the battle of Agincourt, a longbow, paintings, furniture, swords, flintlock rifles, silverware, crystal chandeliers, and books dating back to the 17th century. The auction, consisting of 238 lots, is being held by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire this Saturday.

Michael Scott Shemansky is on the run as a suspect in the murder of his mother, Sandra Shemansky, who was found dead at their shared home in Winter Garden after a family member requested a well-being check. Shemansky failed to appear for a supervised visit with his son on the same day his mother's body was discovered. He is on parole for battery on law enforcement, has a history of bipolar mental illness, and was involuntarily committed to a psychiatric ward for an attempted suicide. Authorities have the murder weapon. Shemansky was last seen fleeing on foot without provisions or medication. Anyone with information should contact authorities at 407-656-3636.

The city of Eugene in the United States has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships. The decision was made by the International Association of Athletics Federations council, who decided to bypass the usual bidding process because of what it saw as a `unique strategic opportunity to host the IAAF World Championships for the first time in the USA'. Eugene failed in its bid to host the 2019 event, which was instead awarded to Doha. The 2007 world championships held in Osaka, Japan was also awarded without a bidding process.

Leonie Granger, an aspiring model, was jailed for 16 years for the manslaughter of professional gambler Mehmet Hassan. Granger used her looks to befriend Hassan after seeing him with a lot of cash at a casino. She later left his door unlocked so her boyfriend, Kyrron Jackson, and an accomplice, Nicholas Chandler, could rob him. Jackson and Chandler tied up Hassan, kicked him to death, and ransacked his home. Jackson and Chandler were found guilty of murder and were jailed for life with a minimum term of 36 years.

Cesc Fabregas' form has declined in the second half of the season, continuing a trend seen during his time at Barcelona. After a brilliant start to the season with Chelsea, his form has dropped off. Barcelona released a statement pointing at his traditional post-Christmas slump after his £30million transfer to Chelsea last summer. Despite this, Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho hopes Fabregas will find form again to help Chelsea win the premier league title.

West Ham are discussing a deal for Jamaican starlet Deshane Beckford after he impressed on trial. The 17-year-old forward from Montego Bay United was invited to train with West Ham's academy earlier this month and has impressed coaches after spending two weeks with the club. Beckford also has offers from clubs in Belgium. West Ham have revealed season tickets at the Olympic Stadium will cost as little as £289 and will have the cheapest pricing strategy in the Barclays Premier League in a bid to fill the 54,000 capacity stadium when they make the switch for the 2016-17 season.

Mike Lane, 40, was assaulted by balaclava-clad protesters armed with iron bars on ropes. The attack occurred at Everleigh, near Amesbury, while the Tedworth hunt was chasing an artificial scent. Lane was kicked in the head, resulting in concussion, broken teeth, memory loss, and a swollen face. Despite video evidence and a dossier of evidence given to Wiltshire police, the investigation has been dropped due to insufficient evidence. Wiltshire Police confirmed that the case has been recorded as undetected, but could be re-opened if other evidence surfaces.

Adam Gadahn, known as the American mouthpiece of al Qaeda, was killed in January in a U.S. government counterterrorism operation. Gadahn was born in 1978, converted to Islam in 1995, and left the U.S. for Pakistan in 1998. After 9/11, he became al Qaeda's chief official English-language propagandist and appeared in videos threatening attacks and urging Muslims to target American, Western, and Jewish interests. In 2006, he was indicted for treason and material support to al Qaeda and was among the FBI's "most wanted terrorists." Gadahn appeared in videos commemorating the 9/11 attacks and urged Muslims in the United States to stage their own lone-wolf attacks. His final video was posted online in September 2014. Gadahn was married to a Muslim woman from Afghanistan and reportedly had at least one child.

A viral video in China shows five-year-old Mai Zizhuo displaying impressive basketball skills. He has been shooting hoops since he was two and a half years old. His skills have gained him many fans in China, with netizens leaving thousands of comments.

Tom O'Carroll, a leading member of the Paedophile Information Exchange (PIE), has joined the supporters of the media pressure group Hacked Off. O'Carroll attended a Hacked Off rally in the Houses of Parliament on February 25 to lobby MPs for state involvement in media regulation. Hacked Off is campaigning against the Independent Press Standards Organisation and wants MPs to set up a statutory body to regulate the press, as recommended by the Leveson Inquiry. O'Carroll was jailed in 1981 for `corrupting public morals'.

Bondi's Icebergs Club pool was drained on Thursday to create a unique catwalk for Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. The empty pool was used for the ten pieces presentation. Ten pieces is headed up by Icebergs restaurateur Maurice Terzini and his partner Lucy Hinckfuss. The lifestyle brand produces unisex collections of ten pieces designed to be worn in 20 ways. Guests were treated to nibbles by Icebergs and drinks from Santa Vittoria.

Bolton-born boxer Amir Khan spent his Friday at a safari park in northern California with his wife Faryal Makhdoom Khan and his daughter Lamysa. Khan posed with giraffes and sea lions and fed a rare white tiger. Khan announced he will fight former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri on May 30.

A Palestinian teenager's name, Mohammed Abu Khdeir, will be removed from an Israeli memorial commemorating fallen soldiers and victims of terrorism after complaints from his family and others. Abu Khdeir was beaten and burned alive by three Israelis. His father objected to his inclusion on the memorial wall, and Almagor, an organization that works on behalf of victims of terror in Israel, also opposed his inclusion. The National Insurance Institute of Israel will remove Abu Khdeir's name from the memorial following his father's complaints.

A youtube user filmed his young son chasing the family cat around the garden in a bid to get some rest. Footage shows the cat licking his fur before his human friend comes along and plonks himself on top. After a brief moment of stillness, the cat immediately gets up and scurries over to another spot. A later video shows the duo swiftly made up, and the boy is seen gently feeding the cat handfuls of treats.

Robert Kushner, a witness in a Philadelphia police corruption trial, lost his varsity coaching job at Jack M. Barrack Hebrew Academy after testifying about selling marijuana. Kushner testified that officers on trial had stolen $81,000 in cash and 7 pounds of marijuana from him during a 2007 arrest. School officials were unaware of Kushner's history, as he had passed a background check in 2010. Kushner also acknowledged a 2011 arrest and a 2008 guilty plea for driving under the influence. Lawyers for the six former drug squad officers accused of racketeering have said the government case is based on 19 lying drug dealers and a rogue ex-cop.

An explosion at a chemical plant in China's southeastern Fujian province injured six people. The plant, which produces paraxylene (px), a carcinogenic chemical, experienced a blast at an oil storage facility after an oil leak. Five of the six people were injured by broken glass. More than 600 firefighters were sent to battle the blaze and the fire is now under control. The plant was hit by another explosion in July 2013. The construction of px plants has sparked protests in several cities in recent years.

Jack Grealish has a message for premier league referees that he will not pull his socks up. He is renowned for wearing his socks low due to superstition and wears children's shinpads. Grealish was pleased to have finally made his first premier league start for Villa against QPR.

Bobbi Kristina Brown, daughter of Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston, has "global and irreversible brain damage," according to her grandmother, Cissy Houston. Though no longer in a medically induced coma, she remains unresponsive. A source told CNN that she remained in the same neurological state she has been in for nearly three months, does not respond to visitors or familiar voices, and her eyes do not follow a person around the room. She also has a tracheostomy in her throat. Bobby Brown said his daughter's condition had improved, but an attorney for the Brown family said that the kind of life she will lead remains to be seen. Doctors have indicated that she will have a long life and is presently embarking on a rehabilitation process. Bobby Brown was in an "emotional state" on stage when he said his daughter was awake, according to a statement from his wife, Alicia Etheredge-Brown.

Russia is close to making the Fed Cup final with a 2-0 lead after Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova beat Germany's Sabine Lisicki after Svetlana Kuznetsova beat Julia Goerges. Pavlyuchenkova saved a match point in the second set before beating Lisicki 4-6, 7-6 (4), 6-3. Pavlyuchenkova had 13 double faults, but Lisicki had 63 unforced errors. Russia needs one win from Sunday's three matches to reach the final and bag a first Fed Cup title since 2008.

Residents of New South Wales are warned to brace for more floods and damage, with another storm predicted to hit this week. An east coast low could bring heavy rain from Thursday through Saturday. The State Emergency Service (SES) is concerned that more storms will hamper clean-up efforts, with 4,409 of 24,196 jobs still needing to be completed. The SES is particularly worried about the effect more wild weather will have on the Hunter region. The main impacts of intense rainfall and strong winds will be on coastal areas in the state's northeast, including the northern rivers and mid-north coasts, with heavy falls also likely for southeast Queensland. Rain will increase this week and peak between Thursday and Saturday. The SES will spend the next few days trying to complete as many jobs as possible and warning people to prepare their homes.

Nina Moric, a model who appeared in Ricky Martin's video, told followers that she collapsed due to low blood pressure and was treated in the hospital. This was in response to Italian media reports that she tried to take her own life. She posted photographs on her Instagram account showing her injuries. Her boyfriend suggested that she had tried to commit suicide. Ms. Moric denied these claims, stating that she was taken to the hospital due to a domestic accident and that she fell due to low blood pressure. Italian media claimed Ms. Moric had tried to take her own life in 2009 after taking an overdose. She was once married to Fabrizio Corona, who was jailed for blackmailing celebs.

The British public hopes that Kate and William will choose a traditional name for their second child. A poll revealed that Diana is the favorite name if the baby is a girl, followed by Alice and Charlotte. If the child is a boy, 13 percent of people would like him to be called James, with Alexander as the second favorite. A quarter of the 2,200 people polled hope for a girl. 68 percent of people support William's decision to take six weeks of paternity leave.

A suicide bomber detonated explosives near protesters in eastern Afghanistan, killing 17 and wounding dozens. An Afghan lawmaker was among the 64 wounded. The Taliban denied responsibility, and no other organization has claimed responsibility. The protesters were on their way to join a larger rally against the provincial governor when the attack occurred around 10 a.m. local time.

Dani Alves looks set to leave Barcelona this summer after rejecting the club's final contract offer. Alves has been unable to agree to a new deal with the club and will leave this summer. Alves' agent said that her client had rejected the offer of a three-year contract extension, which was dependent on the player taking part in 60 per cent of matches for the club.

Pablo Osvaldo wants Andrea Pirlo and Francesco Totti to join him at Boca Juniors. Osvaldo thinks that Pirlo and Totti would be a good fit for Boca, and the fans would love to have them. Osvaldo feels Totti would be just as loved if he moved to Argentina.

Amateur jockey Lee Lewis Ferguson had a spectacular fall from his horse at Wincanton, resulting in a cut on his nose. The fall has been watched hundreds of thousands of times online. He is undeterred and back to riding. He considers himself lucky and has gained Twitter followers from the incident.

James Haskell, the London Wasps captain and England flanker, posted an Instagram photo of himself dressed as Iron Man, Robert Downey Jr.'s character, to celebrate the release of the new Avengers movie. Haskell returned to Wasps in 2012 and has surpassed 100 appearances for the club. He has also played rugby in France, Japan, and New Zealand after leaving Wasps in 2009.

The wide leg trouser is at the forefront of Spring/Summer 2015 trends. Skinny jeans have been popular for years, but the wide leg offers an alternative look that has made a comeback since the seventies. The wide leg can be paired with high heels and a simple top. Denim is the easiest way to embrace the trend. Gucci, Celine, and Topshop showcased the wide-leg trouser on their Spring/Summer 2015 runways.

The University of Michigan will proceed with a screening of the film "American Sniper" as part of a series of social events for students called UMix. The decision comes after some students signed a petition asking the school not to show the movie because they believed the movie's depiction of the Iraq war reflected negatively on the Middle East and people from that region. The initial decision to cancel the movie was reversed because it was not consistent with the high value the university of michigan places on freedom of expression. UMix will offer a screening of the family-friendly "Paddington" for those who would rather not attend "American Sniper."

On April 3, on Rottnest Island off Perth in Western Australia, two French tourists ignited an aerosol spray with a lighter, causing a flame to make contact with a quokka. The quokka survived but was singed. The two men, aged 18 and 24, were evicted from the island and charged with animal cruelty and will appear in Fremantle Magistrates Court on April 17.

Alice Barker, a 102-year-old former dancer in New York nightspots in the 1930s and 1940s, had never seen motion pictures of herself dancing because her photographs and memorabilia had been lost. Mark Cantor and some volunteers put together a video of "soundies" and showed them to Barker at her nursing home, which delighted her.

Washing your own car used to be a normal Sunday routine in Britain, but new figures show that it is dying out. A study by vehicle leasing firm OSV found that 31% of men and 75% of women have never washed their own car. Only 12% of men wash their own car regularly. Only 5% of those surveyed had ever asked their children to wash the car. Reasons for this decline include shops now being open on Sundays, more live football on TV, the rise of hand car washes, and the fact that some vehicles are too large to clean. Cars are most likely to be washed every week by their owners in Birmingham, Chelmsford and Sheffield and least likely in Oxford, Bath and Edinburgh. Audis, Toyotas and BMWs are most likely to be washed by their owners and Range Rovers, Peugeots and Mercedes least often.

Martin Skrtel has praised Steven Gerrard's impact since arriving at Anfield in 2008 but believes Liverpool can overcome the challenge of replacing him. Gerrard is set to feature in the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa, with the aim of reaching the final against Arsenal and Gerrard is aiming to end his Liverpool career by making the FA Cup final and beating arsenal. Skrtel believes Gerrard is still one of the best players in the world and helped him to settle at the club. Skrtel believes Liverpool has potential replacements for Gerrard. Both Gerrard and Skrtel could return to the Liverpool line-up for the match against Villa after both served three-match bans.

At age 75, Jack Nicklaus made a hole-in-one on the fourth hole during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. Nicklaus was playing alongside Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw. This was Nicklaus' first ace at Augusta. Camilo Villegas also made an ace on the fourth and one on the eighth, but Kevin Streelman won in a play-off. Nicklaus became the youngest person to wear a green jacket in 1963, and collected his sixth in 1986.

Tornado sirens blared Wednesday night in Kansas as several storms brought reports of twisters. Spotters reported a tornado about 6 miles northwest of Goddard. Other reports of tornadoes came in from southwestern Kansas, near Aetna. The National Weather Service indicated a tornado may have touched down in Potosi, Missouri. On Thursday, more storms are expected in the Midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley and near the southern Great Lakes.

Robert Bates, an Oklahoma reserve sheriff's deputy, pleaded not guilty to second-degree manslaughter for fatally shooting Eric Harris, whom he says he meant to subdue with a taser. The judge granted Bates permission to go to the Bahamas for a family vacation, which prompted a negative response from Harris' family. Bates' preliminary hearing is scheduled for 10 a.m. july 2. Bates claims he meant to stun Harris with a taser after Harris fled from officers, but mistakenly shot Harris with a gun instead. The lawyer for the family of the man who was killed claims that bates was n't qualified to be on the force, but received preferential treatment because he 'd made donations to the agency and was a friend of the sheriff. Two deputies involved in arrest of harris have been reassigned because of threats against them and their families.

Conor McGregor is preparing for a featherweight title challenge against Jose Aldo on July 11 and has revealed a new tiger tattoo on his stomach. McGregor is challenging Jose Aldo for his featherweight champion title in Las Vegas on July 11. Aldo makes his eighth defense of his belt against McGregor. McGregor claims he has greater motivation to win the title than Aldo has to defend it for the eighth time.

Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott was asked to drink a beer by a coach and he obliged, to the ire of anti-drinking campaigners. Critics claim he is glorifying binge drinking and associating being a man with drinking booze. It took the Prime Minister about six seconds to down the schooner as players cheered. A cultural studies professor said it sets up a culture that drinking isn’t about socializing, but about how quickly and how much you can drink. A health minister defended Abbott, saying there was nothing wrong with his antics. Abbott gave a speech to the players and drank the entire schooner, dribbling bits on his shirt.

Indiana has seen a significant increase in HIV cases, with 120 confirmed and 10 preliminary positive cases tied to Scott County. This outbreak, primarily among intravenous drug users of Opana, led to a short-term needle exchange program approved by Gov. Mike Pence. Since the program started, 5,322 clean syringes have been provided to 86 participants, and about 1,400 used syringes have been returned. The future of the Scott County program and legislation for needle-exchange programs in other counties is uncertain, with concerns about promoting drug use and funding being key issues.

An Arsenal fan made his girlfriend, Saskia, take a test about his favorite football club. She scored 43.5 out of 50, or 87%, and he did not dump her as a result. Saskia posted snaps of the test to her Twitter account, and people online had mixed reactions to the boyfriend's actions. Some people hailed the boyfriend as a "legend," while others thought he took things too far.

Carlos Toro, 66, worked for the DEA as an undercover operative for 27 years in exchange for the promise of US citizenship. He worked as a mid-level member of the Medellin cartel in the 1980s. After fleeing Colombia, he began working for the DEA as an informant. He helped carry out undercover stings around the world and aided in the prosecution of Carlos Lehder and Manuel Noriega. He was not paid for his work, but was told he would be rewarded with US citizenship, which has not happened. After declining health forced him to retire, the DEA refused to help Toro with his citizenship, and he is now technically living in the US illegally. He fears for his life if he is deported back to Colombia. A former DEA agent gave Toro $5,000 after the DEA declined to help. Toro remains in limbo while trying to get a green card or a passport, and he cannot collect social security benefits until he secures one of those documents.

A 14-year-old girl in India set herself on fire after allegedly being raped by five men from her village. She is in Delhi’s Safdarjung hospital with 70 per cent burns. The accused men have been arrested. This follows heightened sensitivity to sexual assault in India after officials banned a documentary about the gang rape and murder of an Indian student in Delhi.

Louis van Gaal says he has been dreaming of beating rivals City in Sunday's derby at Old Trafford but will have to do so without Robin van Persie, who Van Gaal does not consider fit enough to play. Luke Shaw is also ruled out due to fitness. Van Gaal wants his side to move towards finishing as high as second or third to avoid a champions league qualifying fixture later in the summer. He acknowledged that City will provide a stern challenge to his team and played down the idea he will be motivated by revenge, after losing the away fixture earlier in the campaign.

Arsenal and Liverpool fans protested rising ticket prices at their game at Emirates Stadium by leaving seats empty for the first 10 minutes. The cheapest tickets were £64. The protest was organized by Arsenal's Black Scarf Movement and Liverpool's Spirit of Shankly and Spion Kop 1906 fan groups. Protesters hope the image of empty seats will raise awareness of the struggles fans face to meet the rising costs.

Star Reader was diagnosed with biliary atresia shortly after being born. After an unsuccessful operation to unblock her bile ducts, doctors said she would need a liver transplant to survive. Her aunt, Shanell Reader, offered part of her liver and saved her niece's life. Star underwent the operation in November, spent six weeks in the hospital, and has since made a good recovery.

Eden Hazard and three of his Blues teammates participated in Audi's football challenge. Hazard and Nathan Ake paired up to take on Loic Remy and Willian in a head-to-head challenge for the car manufacturers. The Chelsea stars aimed to fire balls into the boot of a car from close range, with Hazard and Ake securing the points with a 5-3 win. One of the challenges was to sink balls into convertible Audis from long range. They also played on a makeshift tennis court, where the net was replaced by a £127,000 Audi R8 V10 Plus. Hazard and Ake won the decider to take a 6-0 lead after the first two rounds. The final challenge involved the players shooting at cars from long range, with Remy and Willian winning. Willian smashed the wing mirror off one of the Audis with a long-range effort.

Robert Dellinger, a former Fortune 500 executive from New Hampshire, said he wasn't suicidal during his sentencing for causing a highway crash in December 2013 that killed a Vermont couple, Amanda Murphy and Jason Timmons, and their unborn baby. Dellinger pleaded guilty to negligent homicide and assault and faces 12 to 24 years in prison. His attorneys claimed he was suffering from ambien withdrawal, a psychiatric drug overdose, prozac, and multiple sclerosis.

Lacey Spears of Scottsville, Kentucky, was sentenced to 20 years to life in prison for killing her five-year-old son by poisoning him with salt. The boy's father, Chris Hill, expressed his hope on Facebook that she would die in prison. Prosecutors said Spears made her son ill because she had a bizarre need for attention and that she loaded the hospitalized boy 's feeding tube with a lethal amount of salt and kept on blogging. Spears' lawyer said she was innocent and blamed the hospital for negligence and plans to appeal the verdict.

Due to fears of two new influenza strains, influenza A strain H3N2 and influenza B strain B/Phuket, that caused a spike in deaths in Europe and the United States, an improved vaccination is arriving in Australia a month later than expected. High-risk groups will be able to access free, government-funded flu shots from April 20. Everyone should be getting the vaccine, which also provides protection against influenza A strain H1N1. People should be booking their flu shots now, given the delay in stocks arriving.

Caretakers of Abraham Lincoln's tomb are responding to an unflattering critique in National Geographic and potential budget cuts that could affect the historic site's management. The criticism and financial concerns coincide with the 150th anniversary of Lincoln's assassination. The tomb was described as having "all the historical character of an office lobby" and reconstructed in "incongruous art deco style." The tomb has seen more than $2.5 million in recent repairs and renovations, leaving it in excellent physical condition. The tomb was designed by Vermont sculptor Larkin Mead and dedicated by President Ulysses S. Grant in 1874.

Nineties style is currently popular, but the return of JNCO jeans has been met with horror. Other trends from the nineties and noughties that are making a comeback include bucket hats, camouflage print, taking trends to the max, Ugg boots, daisy dukes, Juicy Couture tracksuits, colored sunglasses, corsets as outfits, and harem pants. Celebrities such as Rihanna, Jourdan Dunn, Kylie Jenner, Kristen Bell, Miley Cyrus, Nicki Minaj, Cara Delevingne, Selena Gomez, and Elle Macpherson have been seen sporting these resurrected styles.

-Four rainbows appeared in the sky in New York after a large amount of rain.
-China is cracking down on hiring exotic dancers to perform at wakes.
-RDJ grew agitated when asked about his private life.
-A new trend called lip plumping has emerged where people suck on a jar to look like Kylie Jenner.
-102-year-old Alice Barker went back in time with the help of some filmmakers.
-One school wouldn't allow a prom-posal that referenced bombs.
-Ewan McGregor will play Lumiere in 'Beauty and the Beast'.
-Johnny Depp is nearly unrecognizable in the 'Black Mass' trailer.
-One person announced they were pregnant by referencing "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air."

Serena Williams received a giant cake after her 700th career victory, following Andy Murray’s 500th win which was also celebrated with a cake. Williams beat Sabine Lisicki in three sets to progress to the Miami Open semi-finals. She will face Simona Halep for a place in the final after Halep beat Sloane Stephens.

Sabeen Mahmud was shot dead in Pakistan after hosting a discussion on human rights. No one has claimed responsibility, but Mahmud had received death threats in the past for discussing the topic. Mahmud was a figurehead for humanism, love, and tolerance in Pakistan, and her death has been met with grief and gratitude.

Mangu Ram, an 82-year-old Hindu refugee, fled to Kashmir 70 years ago and is still considered a second-class citizen, unable to own property or vote in state elections. There are around 100,000 people classified as refugees. Because of the dispute with Pakistan, rulers have not granted residential rights to refugees, fearing it will upset the demographic balance in India's only Muslim-majority state. With the success of Narendra Modi's Hindu nationalist party, there is hope for change, but activists warn they will take matters into their own hands if their hopes are dashed.

Yoshinori Muto is considering joining Chelsea, who have made an offer of around £4 million for him. Chelsea would loan Muto to Vitesse Arnhem, but Muto wants to play regularly for a club where he can develop. Real Zaragoza boss Ranko Popovic believes Muto could be a big hit at Stamford Bridge. Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho is aware of Muto and admits that commercial interests play a part in the club's transfer policy.

Australia is congratulated for dropping its policy of not selecting overseas players, which makes England look old-fashioned. Stuart Lancaster should be free to pick his best players, no matter where they play. Matt Giteau's performances for Toulon have put him back on Australia's radar for the World Cup. Steffon Armitage and Nick Abendanon have improved since playing in France. Jonny Wilkinson also improved when he moved to France. The England coach will be judged on the World Cup performance and needs to select the best starting XV. Every player wants England to win the World Cup, which starts with picking the best team. England head coach Stuart Lancaster has remained steadfast in his policy not to select overseas players. Toulon has Bryan Habana playing for South Africa and Leigh Halfpenny playing for Wales, who are among the best players in the world.

Open Garden's Firechat app allows users to chat without web or mobile signal by creating a wireless mesh network using Apple's Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF) or a similar feature on Android. Each phone acts as a node, passing data between users within Bluetooth or Wi-Fi range (around 30 feet). Greenstone, a small, egg-shaped gadget, acts as a beacon to strengthen these networks, overcoming the 200ft message limit. Firechat, downloaded over five million times, is useful on planes or underground and saves on data plans. Greenstone, still in development, works with Firechat at a 20ft range, holding 1,000 messages with a one-year battery life, and is designed for resilient communication in areas lacking connectivity.

Lillian Bustle, a burlesque performer from New Jersey, is attempting to eradicate negativity surrounding the word 'fat' by embracing it as an honest, body-positive description of her physique. During a TED Talk, Lillian explained that 'fat' is just another word and shouldn't be a synonym for 'ugly'. Size discrimination in the workplace has risen, and the top 'magic wish' for girls is to be thinner, but studies show that the more people are exposed to body diversity, the more they accept different body types. Lillian hopes that exposing her audience to a fuller figure will change their perceptions. Since her TED talk was posted on YouTube, Lillian has received positive feedback.

Theo Walcott, along with Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini, and Mesut Ozil, posed for an official portrait for Lanvin with runway model Olga Sherer. Lanvin is the club's official tailor since 2013. Arsenal's first team will be dressed in similar attire for the FA Cup final against Aston Villa on May 30. Walcott has been on the substitutes' bench for 17 of 33 Premier League games.

Rick Baker's collection of props and puppets from his Cinovation Studio will be auctioned off on May 29 at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California, and on propstore.com. The collection is worth an estimated $746,100 and includes 417 original items from more than 50 productions from Baker's 30-year career. Some of the items include Alien Edgar Bug from Men in Black, the Two Face mask from Batman Forever, and the Grinch costume from How the Grinch Stole Christmas.

Seven-year-old Carwyn Scott-Howell died in the French Alps after becoming separated from his mother while skiing. Carwyn entered dense woodland and fell over a 164ft drop. His body was found by police who followed his footprints in the snow. Carwyn's family described him as a `daring, outgoing and determined' youngster. The family said they had spent `the most happy ski holiday together' in the resort of Flaine before the tragedy.

Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old from Whitley Bay, developed anorexia due to pressures to be a size zero. At her worst, she was surviving on about 100 calories a day, sometimes just a piece of fruit, and hid food to deceive her mother. After collapsing, she was hospitalized and put on a heart monitor. She has since spoken out about her two-year fight with anorexia and is now in recovery, working with eating disorder teams. She is now a semi finalist in Miss Teen GB.

Liverpool supporters made it clear to Raheem Sterling that they expect him to remain at the club this summer. This occurred on the day he was presenting the club's new home kit at Anfield. The new gingham design is the first from US sports brand New Balance, who struck a record-breaking £300 million four-year kit deal. Liverpool stars, including Sterling, Daniel Sturridge, Martin Skrtel and Simon Mignolet, presented the kit to fans. The new shirt features all white branding and an all-new style of collar. The memorial flame and number 96 is also on the shirt in tribute to the casualties at the Hillsborough disaster in 1989.

A high-definition map of dark matter has been produced by University of Manchester researchers. The map shows clumps of dark matter across 0.4 percent of the sky. The goal is to eventually map 12.5 percent of the sky over five years to allow astronomers to study how galaxies formed. The map was created using data captured by the Dark Energy Camera using the victor m. blanco telescope in Chile. Dark matter makes up at least 80 percent of the matter in the known universe, and the survey looks for its effect on galaxies. The survey has completed its second year and will be completed by 2018, mapping an eighth of the sky.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign PSV Eindhoven star Memphis Depay, who is 21 years old. Man U manager Louis van Gaal is familiar with Depay, having named him in his 23-man World Cup squad in 2014. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season. PSV Eindhoven won their first Eredivisie title in seven years after beating Heerenveen 4-1. Depay was born in 1994 and has made over 100 appearances for the Dutch giants. He was also selected for Holland's World Cup squad in 2014.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City's young side with a 3-1 lead. Tammy Abraham scored two goals, and Dominic Solanke scored late in the game. Isaac Buckley-Ricketts scored for Manchester City. Several players from both teams were highlighted for their performance, including Kjetil Haug, Pablo Maffeo, Tosin Adarabioyo, Cameron Humphreys-Grant, Jose Angelino Tasende, Kean Bryan, Aaron Nemane, Bersant Celina, Manu Garcia, Brandon Barker, Bradley Collins, Fikayo Tomori, Ola Aina, Jake Clarke-Salter, Jay Dasilva, Ruben Sammut, Charlie Colkett, Charly Musonda, and Isaiah Brown.

Marco Rubio believes people are born with a sexual preference, but that same-sex marriage should not be a constitutional right and that states should regulate marriage. He would attend the same-sex wedding of someone he cared for, even if he did not agree with it.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde quit their restaurant jobs in Manchester to pursue their dream of discovering the planet "a pedal at a time." The couple started in London and have been cycling for 356 days, covering almost 7,000 miles through 16 countries. They live on less than three euros each a day by camping, using hosting websites, and relying on the kindness of strangers for accommodation. They have traveled through Europe and Turkey and plan to continue into Asia, across the Pacific, and cycle the length of the American continent.

In 2012, a Texas couple had a wedding party where the photo booth snapshots from Premiere Photos allegedly printed "poor n***** party" on the bottom of the pictures. The couple, represented by attorney Cathy Hale, is suing James Evans, the owner of Premiere Photos, under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act for negligence and breach of contract. Evans has denied the allegations, and mediation is scheduled, with a trial set for July if no agreement is reached. The couple is seeking an apology from James Evans.

Mike Brown is taking a cautious approach in recovering from his concussion setback and is unsure when he will return to action for the Harlequins. He suffered a headache after the France game and does not want to risk a long absence like Johnny Sexton. George North has been advised by medics to not play again this season after suffering four concussions. Brown was knocked out cold in the Italy game in February and pulled out of the Ireland game due to concussion symptoms. He credits world rugby online modules for the increased awareness of concussion symptoms, and urges players to be honest and not play on if they are showing symptoms.

A leading expert suggests smartphone use may be to blame for a drop in the number of times couples are having sex each month. Research has revealed that the frequency with which Britons are having sex has been in decline since the emergence of the internet. A typical heterosexual couple was now having sex three times a month, compared to four times a month in 2000 and five times a month in 1990. Professor David Spiegelhalter says people are checking their emails all the time, and you do not have the same sort of quiet empty time that there used to be. A more realistic explanation is that as we've become better connected technologically, our lives have become busier with the boundaries eroded between home, work and the outside world, squeezing out time we would have spent with our other halves. Catherine Mercer says with an increasing number of competing demands on our time, sex just falls down our list of priorities.

Tibetan mastiffs, which can weigh 80 kg and were once prized and sold for up to £1.2 million each, are now unpopular in China and sent to slaughterhouses. This decline is due to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown, bans on owning dogs over 50 kg in some cities, and breeders damaging the quality of the breed. Animal-welfare workers rescued 20 mastiffs being transported to a slaughterhouse, where a third of the dogs were already dead. It is feared that hundreds of dogs are meeting a similar fate, with some being stolen and sold to slaughterhouses. The breed's boom began in 2005, but rapid urbanization has made people realize that Tibetan mastiffs are not well-suited to city living.

Every woman surveyed in Paris claimed to have been a victim of some kind of sexual harassment on the city's public transport, with half assaulted before they were 18 years old. The poll led to calls for a campaign to stem sexist or threatening behavior on buses and trains. Six out of ten women were afraid of being attacked on public transport compared to three out of ten men.

Direct Line is running a competition called #everydayfix, where groups designed products to deal with common problems. People picked their top ten 'everyday emergencies' and Makerversity designed products to alleviate certain emergencies. Three products were shortlisted: Snooze, Forget Me Lock, and Nipper. You can vote for your favorite on Twitter by retweeting tweets about the product. The tweet with the most retweets by 46 April will go into a Kickstarter fundraising campaign and into development.

Police Crime Commissioner Vera Baird is facing a Ministry of Justice investigation after allocating over £500,000 of public money to Victims First Northumbria, a charity she runs as a director alongside Chief Constable Sue Sim. Critics, including Keith Vaz, have accused them of a conflict of interest and creating a "soap opera." The Ministry of Justice will investigate any potential breaches of conflict of interest rules.

Corry Campbell, the ringleader of a gang known as the 'tattoo terrorists', was jailed for 20 years for the assault on Greg Valecce. Valecce was beaten, tied to a chair, and covered in offensive tattoos in the basement of Campbell's mother's house. Sandra Ng was sentenced to 23 months in state prison for her role in the assault. Carl Halin received the same sentence as Campbell. David Harrison is awaiting sentencing, while Jennifer Pratt is awaiting trial.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign PSV Eindhoven star Memphis Depay, who is 21 years old. Man U manager Louis van Gaal is familiar with Depay, having named him in his 23-man World Cup squad in 2014. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season. PSV Eindhoven won their first Eredivisie title in seven years after beating Heerenveen 4-1. Depay was born in 1994 and has made over 100 appearances for the Dutch giants. He was also selected for Holland's World Cup squad in 2014.

Chelsea secured a 3-1 lead in Manchester against City's young side, with Tammy Abraham scoring twice and Dominic Solanke adding a late goal. Abraham's goals were his 35th and 36th of the season. Several players from both teams were highlighted for their performances, including Kjetil Haug, Pablo Maffeo, Tosin Adarabioyo, Cameron Humphreys-Grant, Jose Angelino Tasende, Kean Bryan, Aaron Nemane, Bersant Celina, Manu Garcia, Isaac Buckley-Ricketts, Brandon Barker, Bradley Collins, Fikayo Tomori, Ola Aina, Jake Clarke-Salter, Jay Dasilva, Ruben Sammut, Charlie Colkett, Charly Musonda, Isaiah Brown and Kasey Palmer.

Marco Rubio believes people are born with a sexual preference, but that same-sex marriage should not be a constitutional right and that states should regulate marriage. Although he is against gay marriage, he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staffer.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde quit their restaurant jobs in Manchester to pursue their dream of discovering the planet "a pedal at a time." The couple started in London and have been cycling for 356 days, covering almost 7,000 miles through 16 countries. They live on less than three euros each a day by camping, using hosting websites, and relying on the kindness of strangers for accommodation. They have traveled through Europe and Turkey and plan to continue into Asia, across the Pacific, with the idea to cycle the length of the American continent.

Mike Brown is taking a cautious approach in recovering from his latest concussion setback and is unsure when he will return to action for the Harlequins. Brown does not want to be out for an extended period and will not rush his return. George North has been advised by medics to not play again this season after suffering four concussions. Brown was knocked out cold in England's game against Italy in February. Brown pulled out of the Ireland game due to concussion symptoms and credits world rugby online modules for helping him realize he was not ready to play.

A leading expert suggests smartphone use may be to blame for a drop in the number of times couples are having sex each month. Research has revealed that the frequency with which Britons are having sex has been in decline since the emergence of the internet. A typical heterosexual couple was now having sex three times a month, compared to four times a month in 2000 and five times a month in 1990. Professor David Spiegelhalter says people are checking their emails all the time, and a more realistic explanation is that as we've become better connected technologically, our lives have become busier with the boundaries eroded between home, work, and the outside world, squeezing out time we would have spent with our other halves. Catherine Mercer says that with an increasing number of competing demands on our time, sex just falls down our list of priorities.

Tibetan mastiffs, which can weigh 80 kg and were once prized status symbols fetching prices up to £1.2 million, are now being sent to slaughterhouses in China. This decline is attributed to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown, which has stopped people from giving them as gifts, and bans on owning dogs over 50 kg in some cities. Animal welfare workers rescued 20 mastiffs being transported to a slaughterhouse, where they would be used for hotpot meat and leather belts. Many dogs are meeting a cruel fate, with some being stolen or sold off by breeders due to a glut of poor-quality dogs resulting from cross-breeding.
